revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-07 22:38:59.000000000', 'message': "Update really old comments about vmware hosts managing multiple nodes

The vCenter driver hasn't supported managing multiple nodes from
a single compute host service since change
Ifc17c5049e3ed29c8dd130339207907b00433960 in Liberty. This
change updates some comments to avoid confusion. The only in-tree
virt driver that supports 1:M host:node is Ironic.

Change-Id: Ia14b83459366b299dc3dba2948ffc70368318a9d
"}]
commit_message:
Update really old comments about vmware hosts managing multiple nodes

The vCenter driver hasn't supported managing multiple nodes from
a single compute host service since change
Ifc17c5049e3ed29c8dd130339207907b00433960 in Liberty. This
change updates some comments to avoid confusion. The only in-tree
virt driver that supports 1:M host:node is Ironic.

Change-Id: Ia14b83459366b299dc3dba2948ffc70368318a9d

subject: check stale actionplans and actions
messages:
[{'account_id': 21692, 'date': '2017-12-07 06:26:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19055, 'date': '2017-12-07 12:27:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

what if you run two appliers and one of them still continue to execute action plans?'}, {'account_id': 19055, 'date': '2017-12-07 12:33:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 21692, 'date': '2017-12-08 01:30:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

In ZTE's product, we set the HA to stand-by for multi Appliers.
they can't execute actionplans at the same time.
We just set Watcher API to workload-balance."}, {'account_id': 19055, 'date': '2017-12-08 13:50:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> In ZTE's product, we set the HA to stand-by for multi Appliers.
 > they can't execute actionplans at the same time.
 > We just set Watcher API to workload-balance.

What if someone would like to adapt Watcher to active-active mode?
I agree that by using active-passive mode this patch set fixes the issue,
but maybe there is another way to fix it for active-active?"}, {'account_id': 21692, 'date': '2017-12-12 02:20:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> > In ZTE's product, we set the HA to stand-by for multi Appliers.
 > > they can't execute actionplans at the same time.
 > > We just set Watcher API to workload-balance.
 > 
 > What if someone would like to adapt Watcher to active-active mode?
 > I agree that by using active-passive mode this patch set fixes the
 > issue,
 > but maybe there is another way to fix it for active-active?

At present, I don't think watcher can support active-active mode.
There are some problems:
1, Two actionplans executing at the same time may operate the same VM and the result can not be predicted.
2. If the goals of both actionplans are Consolidation and balance, the result can not be predicted, but watcher has no limit at present;
3, If running two audits at the same time, the resulting actionplan may conflict.
Also, I think we need a bp to consider supporting active-active mode."}, {'account_id': 19457, 'date': '2017-12-12 07:13:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

IMHO, with scope it can be possiblity that a user may target to run actionplans on different AZ'}, {'account_id': 21692, 'date': '2017-12-13 01:41:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> IMHO, with scope it can be possiblity that a user may target to run
 > actionplans on different AZ

You are right ,if users know the restriction, they can aovid it.'}, {'account_id': 21692, 'date': '2018-08-15 08:34:12.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/578102/'}]

Closes-Bug: #1735340
"}]
commit_message:
check stale actionplans and actions

If there are 'ONGOING' actionplans when the Applier starts.
We should cancel these stale actionplans.

Change-Id: I23081015b49076fdf1a82f5150ae33eaf50ec3b0
Closes-Bug: #1735340

subject: Spec of cluster supporting.
messages:
[{'account_id': 22608, 'date': '2018-04-25 05:34:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22608, 'date': '2018-04-25 05:38:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 25113, 'date': '2018-04-25 06:49:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Spec's file must uses 'rst' extension"}, {'account_id': 22608, 'date': '2018-04-25 07:50:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Spec's file must uses 'rst' extension

Thanks review, and there must have some other format problem，after we discussed the detail of this spec. I would them together."}, {'account_id': 22608, 'date': '2018-04-26 04:55:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 22608, 'date': '2018-04-26 04:59:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 22694, 'date': '2018-05-03 07:51:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I investigated a bit, our current rolling-restart, the process is to get all the nodes in the cluster, and then restart the operation. On galera, I manually reproduced this process. There are so few conclusions 1.three node galera cluster stops one node and the other two nodes can still perform read and write operations. 2. When the node that was stopped is started, the data of the other two nodes will be synchronized.
My concern is that this kind of restart method is actually have a prerequisite - the cluster must be up and running before restarting. If partitions and other errors occur, resulting in data synchronization between nodes, we may not be able to restart the cluster. (This involves needing to have the latest data node as the first node in the restart cluster.)

Will continue to investigate'}, {'account_id': 25113, 'date': '2018-05-03 09:43:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(8 comments)

In-line comments may have old ones, please ignore them. :)'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-05-03 16:02:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(12 comments)

-1 for now. This is my first reading through, several topics still need more investigations, I'll come back to this from time to time.

Thanks a lot for this spec, zhanggang."}, {'account_id': 22608, 'date': '2018-05-04 08:24:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(7 comments)

Thanks all the comments of you guys. The new update just fix the format and some reference, contain most of the info for further discussion with other reviewers.'}, {'account_id': 22608, 'date': '2018-05-04 08:25:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Met some network problem, git review got a "Network is unreachable". After reconnect will try again'}, {'account_id': 22694, 'date': '2018-05-14 07:46:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Hi, guys, I saw the meeting record last week. I have some suggestions.
1. The current status actually refers to task_status. Creating a new cluster_status just refers task_status and instance_status doesn't look like a complete way. I explain below my opinion
2. for the user, the user expectations for the cluster_status I actually think there are only two, one is available, one is not available. If you still need a state, I think it is a state that needs maintenance but is still available.

Because we may now encounter such a scenario, the mariadb galera cluster with three nodes, if one or two nodes are turned off, the mariadb galera cluster is still available (should, because I remember his state is still primary The cluster size is 1, which needs to be verified again. In this case, we only need to tell the user that the cluster status of the cluster is available, or it needs to be maintained but is available. Determining whether this cluster is available is not completely determined by the state of the instance in the cluster. We may need to go to all nodes to see the use of show variables like '%wsrep%', according to some of the key values ​​to determine.
If it is a mongodb cluster, and I remember correctly, rs.status() will provide the status of the replication set.

So I think this may need to investigate one by one. What I now know is the mysqladmin ping used by our mysql (if I remember correctly),for a certain situation, the state of a single node is not enough for the judgment of the cluster state."}, {'account_id': 22608, 'date': '2018-08-15 08:32:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1'}]

messages: [{'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-08-14 20:24:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-08-14 20:41:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15993, 'date': '2018-08-14 20:54:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-08-15 08:23:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit c809a93f0bb10c3a95eb2cd22aba54c4309bdf45'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-14 20:24:00.000000000', 'message': "Set private sandbox options to false by default

The private sandbox options are emitting odd behaviour in newer kernels.
This change sets the sandbox options to false by default so that we're
not creating unexpected issues.

Change-Id: I670ae94525f80e70f03327591cba0e27c2ac0f2b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Set private sandbox options to false by default

The private sandbox options are emitting odd behaviour in newer kernels.
This change sets the sandbox options to false by default so that we're
not creating unexpected issues.

Change-Id: I670ae94525f80e70f03327591cba0e27c2ac0f2b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

subject: Patch Pike to fix the monasca ui access issue
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6593, 'name': 'Dirk Mueller', 'email': 'dirk@dmllr.de', 'username': 'dmllr'}, {'_account_id': 10311, 'name': 'Joseph Davis', 'email': 'joseph.davis@suse.com', 'username': 'joadavis'}, {'_account_id': 11880, 'name': 'Gloria Gu', 'email': 'gloriafanggu@gmail.com', 'username': 'gugl'}, {'_account_id': 12156, 'name': 'Jeremy Moffitt', 'email': 'jmoffitt@suse.com', 'username': 'jmoffitt'}, {'_account_id': 12542, 'name': 'Johannes Grassler', 'email': 'jgr-launchpad@btw23.de', 'username': 'jgrassler'}, {'_account_id': 13294, 'name': 'Javier Peña', 'email': 'jpena@redhat.com', 'username': 'jpena'}, {'_account_id': 13404, 'name': 'Alberto Planas', 'email': 'aplanas@gmail.com', 'username': 'aplanas'}, {'_account_id': 19648, 'name': 'SUSE Cloud CI', 'email': 'dmueller+suse-cloud-ci@suse.de', 'username': 'suse-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2018-07-17 23:25:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12156, 'date': '2018-07-18 17:17:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

It looks like something has caused the allow-raw-grafana-links.patch to fail to apply (at least thats the patch that causes a failure when I try to build the rpm locally), guessing something changed in the base source code.'}, {'account_id': 12156, 'date': '2018-07-18 22:35:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

you're going to need the fix in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583676/  for the RDO CI job... and we need to figure out whats failing the openstack-tox-linters job as well"}, {'account_id': 12156, 'date': '2018-08-02 15:53:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2018-08-02 22:47:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

File change looks good to me, and the SUSE CI failure looks like it is vmware-nsx related.'}, {'account_id': 12542, 'date': '2018-08-03 06:48:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 12156, 'date': '2018-08-03 16:09:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2018-08-03 16:12:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-08-07 20:03:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

please reference the upstream change-id in the patch instead of creating a custom patch that has no information where it came from or what it is good for. 

also I do wonder - this patch depends on a corresponding change in defaults in the monasca-api package and I don't see a review for that, could you please update that as well?"}, {'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2018-08-09 18:17:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

@Dirk, Thanks. Will update the change id in patch file.'}, {'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2018-08-09 18:22:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 12156, 'date': '2018-08-09 18:59:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2018-08-13 09:43:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 13294, 'date': '2018-08-14 10:14:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The upstream patch was abandoned, do we want to carry it downstream?'}, {'account_id': 12156, 'date': '2018-08-14 15:25:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

the pike and queens backports were abandoned, but the change should be in Rocky: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/563498/  , this patch allows us to patch Pike...'}, {'account_id': 11880, 'date': '2018-08-14 17:11:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> The upstream patch was abandoned, do we want to carry it
 > downstream?

Also pike is too old to patch upstream. In order to fix the defect QA found, this is the downstream patch for pike cloud 8.'}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2018-08-14 18:30:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13404, 'date': '2018-08-15 07:59:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

Sorry to be negative but I don't really like that we just give up and say only use ascii passwords.  It actually shows up real bugs that should be fixed; I'm reminded of I3ef7e3e539e35ce040573f2044ab6eb3c990200a .  from the linked bug it seems cinder had an issue; IMO it should be investigated"}, {'account_id': 26571, 'date': '2018-08-13 06:44:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

That's alright, Ian. I saw this bug report and think maybe I can help. I am glad that there is a better solution."}, {'account_id': 26571, 'date': '2018-08-15 07:45:05.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

There is a better solution.'}]

commit_message:
Passwords in DevStack Quickstart Guide

The quickstart guide for DevStack needs to
include a warning about password limitations
(special characters) for some of the services
in the local.conf file.

Change-Id: Ibf711c579f412be183337fa82a700f7f24e77137
Closes-Bug: #1744985

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-08 09:36:23.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Iaef151a13d99a2eb975283a2f175245547c455e1
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Iaef151a13d99a2eb975283a2f175245547c455e1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 08:31:22.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I72fde501af1b17e66acd07db246ef41d9af388b1
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I72fde501af1b17e66acd07db246ef41d9af388b1

commit_message:
Remove blacklisted py3 xen tests

Xen UT failures seem to have cleared up, which may or may not have
anything to do with [1]. Remove the blacklist file and get these back
in the py3 jobs.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/591061/

commit_message:
Use full path to workaround scripts.

Scripts with workarounds are not present in PATH so existing calls
to them fails, for e.g.:
  pre_undercloud_upgrade_workarounds.sh: command not found

Change-Id: I023108f99be3a06be655fcc24d971e839019965d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 03:23:23.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Id3a3f97de37ffd261ba69bd1057ddfe5c4969a15
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Id3a3f97de37ffd261ba69bd1057ddfe5c4969a15

fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-30 18:59:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fix failover when multiple amphora have failed

If a load balancer loses more than one amphora at the same time
the failover process will fail and leave the load balancer in
provisioning status ERROR.

This patch resolves this by failing over one amphora at a time
marking any amphora that are also failed in status ERROR. The health
manager will then failover the other failed amphora in subsequent checks.

This patch will update multiple healthy amphora in parallel and will
timeout failed amphroa using the new "active_connection_max_retries"
configuration setting used for "fail-fast" connections.

The patch also updates the amphora failover flow documentation to
show the full flow and not just the spares failover flow.

It updates the amphora driver "get_diagnostics" method to pass instead
of error.

It also adds a AmphoraComputeConnectivityWait task to explicitly wait
for a compute instance to come up and be reachable. This allows a longer
timeout and clarifies this may fail due to compute (nova) failures.
Previously the first plug vip task would do this wait.

Change-Id: Ief97ddda8261b5bbc54c6824f90ae9c7a2d81701
Story: 2001481
Task: 6202
(cherry picked from commit 0139f12c2ecacd96b006ca81ca9f74c7e171231f)

commit_message:
Fix failover when multiple amphora have failed

If a load balancer loses more than one amphora at the same time
the failover process will fail and leave the load balancer in
provisioning status ERROR.

This patch resolves this by failing over one amphora at a time
marking any amphora that are also failed in status ERROR. The health
manager will then failover the other failed amphora in subsequent checks.

This patch will update multiple healthy amphora in parallel and will
timeout failed amphroa using the new "active_connection_max_retries"
configuration setting used for "fail-fast" connections.

The patch also updates the amphora failover flow documentation to
show the full flow and not just the spares failover flow.

It updates the amphora driver "get_diagnostics" method to pass instead
of error.

It also adds a AmphoraComputeConnectivityWait task to explicitly wait
for a compute instance to come up and be reachable. This allows a longer
timeout and clarifies this may fail due to compute (nova) failures.
Previously the first plug vip task would do this wait.

Change-Id: Ief97ddda8261b5bbc54c6824f90ae9c7a2d81701
Story: 2001481
Task: 6202
(cherry picked from commit 0139f12c2ecacd96b006ca81ca9f74c7e171231f)

commit_message:
zun: set docker api version to 1.24

Kolla is using Docker API version 1.24 but the default is 1.26
in Zun. We need to configure it to 1.24 so that Zun and Kolla
can work together.

Partial-Bug: #1782055
Change-Id: I072dccc06fe35dccf25068ef0ca8f39cad9fdc60
(cherry picked from commit 34b6a9c786b8a9cd8e457dfe993c582aafe06df0)

subject: Adding Dariusz Krol candidacy for Trove
messages:
[{'account_id': 28646, 'date': '2018-07-31 08:23:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-07-31 09:47:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Thanks, Dariusz Krol.

We discussed about the leadership transfter on the last weekly meeting [1] and the mailing list [2][3]. The other current active Trove team members seems all busy on other things, so the development activities fall quite much in the Rocky cycle. Dariusz Krol is leading a team based on Trove, and they are starting community contributions by improving trove integraton testing with the tempest plugin. There're some patches in the trove-tempest-plugin repo, two of them [4] has already  been merged, and another one will merged soon [5], the other and following patches should be blocked by many other changes in the trove repo which are still under discussion and preparing.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/trove/2018/trove.2018-07-25-14.00.log.html
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-July/132475.html
[3] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-July/132585.html
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/567316/
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/580763/"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-07-31 20:58:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

As can be seen from:

 http://logs.openstack.org/33/587333/1/check/election-tox-ci-checks/fff97ca/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-07-31_08_52_08_876920

and

 https://review.openstack.org/#/q/owner:d.krol@samsung.com+status:open

The candidate doesn't own any qualifying changes and therefore cannot be considered an ATC.  The TC can take this into account when appointing a candidate as PTL fro the Trove project."}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-08-01 15:24:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> As can be seen from:
 > 
 > http://logs.openstack.org/33/587333/1/check/election-tox-ci-checks/fff97ca/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-07-31_08_52_08_876920
 > 
 > and
 > 
 > https://review.openstack.org/#/q/owner:d.krol@samsung.com+status:open
 > 
 > The candidate doesn't own any qualifying changes and therefore
 > cannot be considered an ATC.  The TC can take this into account
 > when appointing a candidate as PTL fro the Trove project.

Hi, tonyb, 
We had our weekly meeting tonight, all attended core members and the new contributors from Samsung R&D Center in Krakow, Poland are agreed on that we only have Dariusz Krol as an PTL candidate and hope he could be accepted as a valid candidate [1]. Would you explain more about the policy about appointing a candidate as PTL for a project like Trove by the TC?

Thanks.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/trove/2018/trove.2018-08-01-14.00.log.html#l-71"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-08-01 20:52:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Hi, tonyb,
 > We had our weekly meeting tonight, all attended core members and
 > the new contributors from Samsung R&D Center in Krakow, Poland are

 > hope he could be accepted as a valid candidate [1]. Would you
 > explain more about the policy about appointing a candidate as PTL
 > for a project like Trove by the TC?
 > 
 > Thanks.
 > 
 > [1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/trove/2018/trove.2018-08-01-14.00.log.html#l-71

The process is described in https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20141128-elections-process-for-leaderless-programs.html

but it boils down to the TC will select a candidate if one is available but for whatever reason wasn't able to participate in the election.  There are other potential outcomes but they're less likley.

I suggest you reply to my email to the TC  http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-August/132690.html with much the same text as above.

it's now out of the hands of election officials so there is little I can do.

Good luck."}, {'account_id': 13157, 'date': '2018-08-02 01:00:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Fix disabled_reason's type in services schema

disable_reason in services schema can be null when status
is enabled, so this is to add null in disable_reason's type.

https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#update-compute-service

Change-Id: I5478eff73675d0f236acddfb5387cc8cd9e91a5c
partially-implements: blueprint full-schema-for-all-microversions

commit_message:
use callback payloads for PRECOMMIT_UPDATE events

This patch switches callbacks over to the payload object style events
[1] for PRECOMMIT_UPDATE based notifications. To do so a neutron-lib
base payload object must be handled for PRECOMMIT_UPDATE events while
at the same time supporting the existing callback args for other event
types. This requires introducing a few temporary shims to handle both
styles of callback args.

Depends-On: Ie6d27df01cd7b87894efc80946d41eb1ebe25bef

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron-lib/latest/contributor/callbacks.html#event-payloads

Change-Id: I7234424b3ec4111f283ae4424a17de429c7eff9c
(cherry picked from commit 638f35473b3fb1a399f3fadb303a752ed273fa3a)

[{'created': '2018-08-07 13:20:10.000000000', 'message': 'Reduce log level on CentOS by default

It also ensures our gates are overriding the default value.

Change-Id: I4ceb5b7d436b258656b0193dd5e2ef3efb44f592
'}, {'created': '2018-08-07 13:23:50.000000000', 'message': 'Set CentOS kernel logging to quiet in gates

This patch also ensures users are aware that centos have a higher level

Change-Id: I4ceb5b7d436b258656b0193dd5e2ef3efb44f592
"}, {'created': '2018-08-07 13:25:32.000000000', 'message': "Set CentOS kernel logging to 'quiet' in AIO

This changes the default console_loglevel to 4, in gates,

Change-Id: I4ceb5b7d436b258656b0193dd5e2ef3efb44f592
"}, {'created': '2018-08-07 13:32:28.000000000', 'message': "Set kernel logging to 'quiet' in AIOs

Currently the default CentOS value is to set printk to
7 4 1 7, showing up all the DEBUG messages.
OpenSUSE Leap 42.3 is using 1 4 1 7, while Ubuntu is
using 4 4 1 7.

This patch changes the default console_loglevel to 4 in AIOs
to only print KERN_WARNING, KERN_ERR, KERN_CRIT, and
KERN_ALERT, as this seems the best balance of reducing logging IO
while still exposing relevant errors in tests.

This patch also ensures users are aware that centos have a higher level
of kernel logging by default, so they can take their own decisions
about it.

Change-Id: I4ceb5b7d436b258656b0193dd5e2ef3efb44f592
"}]
commit_message:
Set kernel logging to 'quiet' in AIOs

Currently the default CentOS value is to set printk to
7 4 1 7, showing up all the DEBUG messages.
OpenSUSE Leap 42.3 is using 1 4 1 7, while Ubuntu is
using 4 4 1 7.

This patch changes the default console_loglevel to 4 in AIOs
to only print KERN_WARNING, KERN_ERR, KERN_CRIT, and
KERN_ALERT, as this seems the best balance of reducing logging IO
while still exposing relevant errors in tests.

This patch also ensures users are aware that centos have a higher level
of kernel logging by default, so they can take their own decisions
about it.

Change-Id: I4ceb5b7d436b258656b0193dd5e2ef3efb44f592

commit_message:
Add container_image_prepare_params to deployment workflow

This change has been broken out from the previous one because
Ifb1f81d4f7db3efd2799beca8705957e29ba16bd had to be reverted due to a
dependency on needing a promoted container image which contains the
action python.

Change-Id: Ie1bd6448684d5885a58c0ba30800b22ec9c105fd
Blueprint: container-prepare-workflow

commit_message:
Ensure Boolean Strings from the environment are treated correctly

This happens because we use six.text_type() to convert the oslo.config
options into a strings so we can pass it via environment
variables[1,2,3].

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/instack-undercloud/tree/instack_undercloud/undercloud.py#n1229
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/instack-undercloud/tree/instack_undercloud/undercloud.py#n1371
[3] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/instack-undercloud/tree/instack_undercloud/undercloud.py#n550

Change-Id: I5830a856960856af1a045d6eda609b8abb20658d
Closes-Bug: 1743679
(cherry picked from commit 28fd5228860d4aeea1bcf7de13d9a4eb8ed6d643)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-12 22:35:51.000000000', 'message': "Support push_destination:true in prepare

The fix for bug #1783204 only handled the upload logic in isolation,
and didn't account for the whole prepare flow. This change completes
push_destination:true support with the following changes:
- container_images_prepare_multi, which is the heat parameter driven
  interface for prepare, use heat parameter LocalContainerRegistry as
  the registry IP, which is only set during undercloud install. This
  handles the case where registry discovery won't work because it is too
  early in the undercloud install process
- container_images_prepare, which is the python library API for
  prepare, make the image registry substitution support
  push_destination:true. The discovery logic can be used here since
  this is only ever called after networking is configured on the
  undercloud

Change-Id: Ia18c89a48ef0fd0f3021823c6049042ac5e78eb8
Related-Bug: #1783204
Closes-Bug: #1786521
"}]
commit_message:
Support push_destination:true in prepare

The fix for bug #1783204 only handled the upload logic in isolation,
and didn't account for the whole prepare flow. This change completes
push_destination:true support with the following changes:
- container_images_prepare_multi, which is the heat parameter driven
  interface for prepare, use heat parameter LocalContainerRegistry as
  the registry IP, which is only set during undercloud install. This
  handles the case where registry discovery won't work because it is too
  early in the undercloud install process
- container_images_prepare, which is the python library API for
  prepare, make the image registry substitution support
  push_destination:true. The discovery logic can be used here since
  this is only ever called after networking is configured on the
  undercloud

Change-Id: Ia18c89a48ef0fd0f3021823c6049042ac5e78eb8
Related-Bug: #1783204
Closes-Bug: #1786521

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-09 03:31:57.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ieb52ad1918074ffdff47e566da4f7005856d3b53
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ieb52ad1918074ffdff47e566da4f7005856d3b53

commit_message:
[WIP] Support multiple forwarding paths in VNFFG

This patch let users can create multiple forwarding paths
using one VNFFG descriptor.

Change-Id: I8d24bc5c9a0f6bc333484728385d465791363b3a
Co-Authored-By: Dimitrios Markou <mardim@intracom-telecom.com>
Co-Authored-By: Stamatis Katsaounis <mokats@intracom-telecom.com>

commit_message:
Test Sahara API with WSGI

Support for Sahara API in WSGI was added in dependency.
This changes so that we test with running Sahara in WSGI.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/590354/
Change-Id: I59424605ff79b49b064fd90246cd70d95421425d

Add rocky featureset010 to the branchful jobs.

voting for now.

commit_message:
Add Browbeat env settings to rdocloud

Required for testing fs053 - where the cloud
and logging hosts have to be set.

Also add browbeat playbook to ovb playbooks list.
Only to be run conditionally.

Change-Id: Ice5de11d0c0ac0a808a0036f57a3f91b73a961bd

commit_message:
Make Xen code py3-compatible

A couple places in the Xen code have been using syntax that is
python2-specific. This replaces those instances with code that will
work in both python2 and python3.

PEP 3108 [1] moves urllib.urlopen to urllib.request.urlopen. The six
module is used in order to work in both python2 and python3 [2].

PEP 3110 [3] changed the grammar for except clauses, such that the
'as' keyword is now required in place of a comma when specifying an
exception variable.

[1] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3108/
[2] https://pythonhosted.org/six/#module-six.moves.urllib.request
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3110/

Change-Id: I1235d767718a4207f4cef3e5b140319d003ad7b0

commit_message:
Fix small nit in enable_validations parameter.

The get_param call wasn't properly formatted
and the script was being rendered with the
following enabled_validations content:
enable_validations=[{u'get_params': u'EnableValidations'}]

Closes-Bug: #1786953
Change-Id: I6c1de0295cb1da4e72b447b78847e1b586b40e4a

Add browbeat-minimal.yml to ovb playbook list

This commit is part of the tripleo-ci team's
Sprint 17 task:

https://trello.com/c/TVsZ3Ut6/877-clean-up-rdo-sf-legacy-code-after-zuulv3-migration

---

As the playbook list has been migrated to here
we need to add the browbeat playbook to the list
of playbooks executed for ovb jobs.

---

The browbeat-minimal playbook lives here:

https://github.com/openstack/browbeat/blob/master/ansible/oooq/browbeat-minimal.yml

The tasks within it are enabled only for fs053 thus:

https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/blob/master/config/general_config/featureset053.yml#L144

---

This review stems from feedback on the patch that
adds a v3 job for browbeat (as a strawman):

https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/15125/2/zuul.d/zuul-v3-jobs.yaml

Change-Id: Ie953d67fa4562b452fe81068c3a84018086d527b

subject: Revert "Include microversion in OS_VOLUME_API_VERSION"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6796, 'name': 'Giulio Fidente', 'email': 'gfidente@redhat.com', 'username': 'gfidente'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 21129, 'name': 'Alan Bishop', 'email': 'abishop@redhat.com', 'username': 'ASBishop'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-14 13:47:55.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Include microversion in OS_VOLUME_API_VERSION"

This reverts commit daa7745c9ef9985fc8decc73ed00c7398da7d2dd.

Using minor version with Cinder results in a breakage with OSCLI, due to
the lack of proper version checking there. For most OSCLI shell commands
it simply results in a warning, however it causes an error with creating
nova instances. For more information see:

https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2003132

Change-Id: I966bf7f6f8d1cbc656abfad59e8bb927e1aa53c2
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Include microversion in OS_VOLUME_API_VERSION"

This reverts commit daa7745c9ef9985fc8decc73ed00c7398da7d2dd.

Using minor version with Cinder results in a breakage with OSCLI, due to
the lack of proper version checking there. For most OSCLI shell commands
it simply results in a warning, however it causes an error with creating
nova instances. For more information see:

https://storyboard.openstack.org/#!/story/2003132

Change-Id: I966bf7f6f8d1cbc656abfad59e8bb927e1aa53c2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-30 21:38:14.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Wait for network-vif-plugged before starting live migration

This adds a new config option which is read on the destination host
during pre_live_migration and the value is returned back to the
source host, which can be used to determine, from the source host,
if it should wait for a "network-vif-plugged" event due to VIFs
being plugged on the destination host.

The option is disabled by default for backward compatibliity and
also because certain networking backends, like OpenDaylight, are
known to not send network-vif-plugged events unless the port host
binding information changes, which for live migration doesn't happen
until after the guest is transferred to the destination host.

We could arguably avoid the changes to the live migrate data
versioned object and just assume the same networking backend is
used within each cell, but this does allow the deployer to have
the flexibility of live migrating between different network
backends (eventually anyway). The ability to live migrate between
different VIF types is being worked on as part of blueprint
neutron-new-port-binding-api.

Change-Id: I0f3ab6604d8b79bdb75cf67571e359cfecc039d8

commit_message:
Wait for network-vif-plugged before starting live migration

This adds a new config option which is read on the destination host
during pre_live_migration and the value is returned back to the
source host, which can be used to determine, from the source host,
if it should wait for a "network-vif-plugged" event due to VIFs
being plugged on the destination host. This helps us to
avoid the guest transfer at all if vif plugging failed on the dest
host, which we just wouldn't find out until post live migration
and then we have to rollback.

The option is disabled by default for backward compatibility and
also because certain networking backends, like OpenDaylight, are
known to not send network-vif-plugged events unless the port host
binding information changes, which for live migration doesn't happen
until after the guest is transferred to the destination host.

We could arguably avoid the changes to the live migrate data
versioned object and just assume the same networking backend is
used within each cell, but this does allow the deployer to have
the flexibility of live migrating between different network
backends (eventually anyway). The ability to live migrate between
different VIF types is being worked on as part of blueprint
neutron-new-port-binding-api.

Related to blueprint neutron-new-port-binding-api

Change-Id: I0f3ab6604d8b79bdb75cf67571e359cfecc039d8

commit_message:
NetApp SolidFire: Fix NetApp SolidFire SSL option

The driver.verify_ssl atribute is being defined before its usage in
the _create_cluster_reference() causing the driver initialization
to fail.

Change-Id: Ic616bbcced22db6eb8c8946dec98aefd84b16c31

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I629d58dc71035804b0fd7773afa1dae430477896
Story: #2003250

commit_message:
placement: ignore policy scope check failures if not enforcing scope

Rather than spam the placement API logs with scope check
warnings from oslo.policy when placement isn't configured
for scope type enforcement, ignore those warnings.

Note that the same warnings filter in the placement WarningsFixture
is left intact because the configuration defaults setting code in
wsgi.py which allows the warning filter to be set in deploy.py,
is not run by the functional tests. In future changes this will
be resolved by unifying configuration handling.

Closes-Bug: #1786498
Related-Bug: #1784663
Change-Id: I34e4e550c9c31a654308e555210588156418f9e3

commit_message:
Update curator to better metric storage

Now that the roll-up has been implemented the original shrink method is
no longer required or useful. This change cleans up things up.

Change-Id: I24fd5b4daafc2f48ee5a3421f6b58b157a7aff6c
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

[{'created': '2018-08-14 18:33:00.000000000', 'message': "Ensure that the neutron services are not in a privatetmp

The use of privatetmp with neutron services that create namespaces
creates broken namespaces. This change will ensure we're not seeing

"}]
commit_message:
Ensure that the neutron services are not in a privatetmp

The use of privatetmp with neutron services that create namespaces
creates broken namespaces. This change will ensure we're not seeing
random brokeness with neutron.

Change-Id: I7795b4d31066b10a70acdce510936b2ec8d2304b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-14 20:13:25.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Decode the output of subprocess in doc/source/conf.py so that we always
have a string.

Change-Id: I17601d56b6e6d9d300bb07d8982a7bbde637822e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
(cherry picked from commit bb234731d3ba2dc1a17d592f0d37a49e3bc74a95)
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Decode the output of subprocess in doc/source/conf.py so that we always
have a string.

Change-Id: I17601d56b6e6d9d300bb07d8982a7bbde637822e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
(cherry picked from commit bb234731d3ba2dc1a17d592f0d37a49e3bc74a95)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-09 23:33:14.000000000', 'message': 'New Airship project - Treasuremap

Airship is a collection of components that provide a declarative
interface for deploying bare metal Kubernetes at scale,
facilitating integrated deployment of OpenStack on Kubernetes.

The Airship Treasuremap project will serve these purposes:

1. House reference deployment manifests that can be used as a
starting point for setting up an Airship site.  The YAML
manifests will be self-documented so that the settings that
typically vary on a site-by-site basis can be easily found.

2. CICD pipelines that will integrate the reference manifests,
the various Airship components, and OpenStack (via OpenStack-Helm)
to ensure that the manifests are always up-to-date and that
changes to Airship and OpenStack-Helm do not result in an
integration regression.

3. A documentation overview of Airship, its components, and how
it can be used.

Change-Id: I0a8d98b544825e9be548031b0fd62d559f7d6722
'}]
commit_message:
New Airship project - Treasuremap

Airship is a collection of components that provide a declarative
interface for deploying bare metal Kubernetes at scale,
facilitating integrated deployment of OpenStack on Kubernetes.

The Airship Treasuremap project will serve these purposes:

1. House reference deployment manifests that can be used as a
starting point for setting up an Airship site.  The YAML
manifests will be self-documented so that the settings that
typically vary on a site-by-site basis can be easily found.

2. CICD pipelines that will integrate the reference manifests,
the various Airship components, and OpenStack (via OpenStack-Helm)
to ensure that the manifests are always up-to-date and that
changes to Airship and OpenStack-Helm do not result in an
integration regression.

3. A documentation overview of Airship, its components, and how
it can be used.

Change-Id: I0a8d98b544825e9be548031b0fd62d559f7d6722

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Ifb81d077390a2d8185c27da418098449cd2e483e
Story: #2003250

commit_message:
Remove api_version setting from volume v3/v2 service client

Volume service clients has been made as generic without
api_version[1] so that catalog_type can select the appropriate
endpoint to make API request.

There are few service clients belonged to v3 still set
api_version which is not needed now.

This commit removes the api_version from volume service
clients completely.
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/527889/

Change-Id: Iaf2d06b0f124e1c7b959785a04a4d770898a1eea

Network related attributes are removed from quota set from
microversion 2.36, and injected file related attributes are
removed from microversion 2.57, so this is to remove them
from schema of quota set according to the microversion.

https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#show-a-quota

commit_message:
Fill quota schema for microversion 2.36/2.57

Network related attributes are removed from quota set from
microversion 2.36, and injected file related attributes are
removed from microversion 2.57, so this is to remove them
from schema of quota set according to the microversion.

Because show_quota_set uses schema get_quota_set when detail
is False and uses schema get_quota_set_details when detail
is True, so this is also to change one get_quota_set calling
to be with detail=True, so to cover the schema check of
get_quota_set_details.

https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#show-a-quota

Change-Id: Ib3762ac10d9fef42e4747710b35073797a36636a
partially-implements: blueprint full-schema-for-all-microversions

commit_message:
Improve restarting Apache

The previous approach could lead to restarting Apache after
Anchor['nova::service::end']. The new approach is already used in other
Puppet modules and guarantees restarting Apache between the service
anchors.

Change-Id: I54367a46ffc7f8478d77f5279940ff0d38a279d6

Change-Id: Iac0c093bbc57a8ae876013d57e74f963e163e4f1

commit_message:
Make providers use auth_url for authentication

When reading credentials from the configuration's keystone_authtoken
section auth_uri was used as URL for Keystone.
As auth_uri is a public endpoint that is not necessarily reachable for
the Puppet agent, this change uses the more appropriate auth_url as
Keystone URL.

Change-Id: Iac0c093bbc57a8ae876013d57e74f963e163e4f1
(cherry picked from commit 1ea7ef9cf673701e4333511414b8e13c3c73dbce)

commit_message:
Make providers use auth_url for authentication

When reading credentials from the configuration's keystone_authtoken
section www_authenticate_uri was used as URL for Keystone.
As www_authenticate_uri is a public endpoint that is not necessarily
reachable for the Puppet agent, this change uses the more appropriate
auth_url as Keystone URL.

Change-Id: Iac0c093bbc57a8ae876013d57e74f963e163e4f1

commit_message:
Improve restarting Apache

The previous approach could lead to restarting Apache after
Anchor['heat::service::end']. The new approach is already used in other
Puppet modules and guarantees restarting Apache between the service
anchors.

Change-Id: Ia4ccc8a6477f490f42b588b3e6a9d5c0f7ff6d88

[{'created': '2018-06-28 15:50:24.000000000', 'message': 'GoodnessWeigher schedules non-type volumes

If the GoodnessWeigher is configured to be the only active weigher within
the scheduler, it cannot schedule a non-typed volumed for creation. This
patch adds a safety assignement to the weigher stats generation to allow
for scheduling untyped volumes.

This patch safely assigns a dictionary data-type to "volume_type" in the
event that:

    weight_properties = {
        "volume_type": None,
        etc..
    }

Volumes created with a volume-type will not cause an exception and will
be scheduled with the volume-type and back-end as configured.

Closes-Bug: 1766966

Change-Id: I7bc77ab02154aee80282e54b19a242bdea0a78ec
Signed-off-by: Eric M Gonzalez <eric@awnix.com>
(cherry picked from commit 34d75ca1a6eea03bc0fe856bf1a63e7d8d60f024)
(cherry picked from commit a02126af7933ae4d5356bc6fa2e3422854ba2838)
'}]
commit_message:
GoodnessWeigher schedules non-type volumes

If the GoodnessWeigher is configured to be the only active weigher within
the scheduler, it cannot schedule a non-typed volumed for creation. This
patch adds a safety assignement to the weigher stats generation to allow
for scheduling untyped volumes.

This patch safely assigns a dictionary data-type to "volume_type" in the
event that:

    weight_properties = {
        "volume_type": None,
        etc..
    }

Volumes created with a volume-type will not cause an exception and will
be scheduled with the volume-type and back-end as configured.

Closes-Bug: 1766966

Change-Id: I7bc77ab02154aee80282e54b19a242bdea0a78ec
Signed-off-by: Eric M Gonzalez <eric@awnix.com>
(cherry picked from commit 34d75ca1a6eea03bc0fe856bf1a63e7d8d60f024)
(cherry picked from commit a02126af7933ae4d5356bc6fa2e3422854ba2838)

commit_message:
Make code py3-compatible (global callable())

global function callable(f) is removed in python3.
It can be replaced with
isinstance(f, collections.Callable)
This patch addresses the change.

Ref : https://docs.python.org/3.1/whatsnew/3.0.html

Change-Id: I47a50fffac14668f90aac043ee22a91bdb7dca41

commit_message:
Add wsgi_processes and wsgi_threads to horizon init

The wsgi_processes and wsgi_threads needs to be configureable
from the horizon init class and then passed to horizon::wsgi::apache.

Conflicts:
  - Clean cherry pick but changing back default values so we do
    not change behaviour for stable/queens but only add the new
    params.

Change-Id: Ic428214d7c84d33272becdb3675252318e8fd1bd

commit_message:
Switch containerized undercloud upgrade job to nv

This job was missing from the promotion pipeline so we ended up with a
bad mistral package. Let's switch this to NV while we wait for the fix
to land.

Change-Id: I0faf216412e3f4757898d46b58e219e5c5d784b5
Related-Bug: #1785833

commit_message:
Improve restarting Apache

The previous approach could lead to restarting Apache after
Anchor['aodh::service::end']. The new approach is already used in other
Puppet modules and guarantees restarting Apache between the service
anchors.

Change-Id: Id88fe6c893964fa5f8dfd3e75c933615b9f6af40

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-03 10:35:29.000000000', 'message': "Make providers use auth_url for authentication

When reading credentials from the configuration's keystone_authtoken
section auth_uri was used as URL for Keystone.
As auth_uri is a public endpoint that is not necessarily reachable for
the Puppet agent, this change uses the more appropriate auth_url as
Keystone URL.

Change-Id: I926effae33eba706897b4861bd1156469500f7af
(cherry picked from commit 4699a63ef0eff69f958a56a458a638c5af820bbb)
"}]
commit_message:
Make providers use auth_url for authentication

When reading credentials from the configuration's keystone_authtoken
section auth_uri was used as URL for Keystone.
As auth_uri is a public endpoint that is not necessarily reachable for
the Puppet agent, this change uses the more appropriate auth_url as
Keystone URL.

Change-Id: I926effae33eba706897b4861bd1156469500f7af
(cherry picked from commit 4699a63ef0eff69f958a56a458a638c5af820bbb)

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Id5955825e33c14514c9be29d923d1ee42c69dda8

[{'created': '2018-06-06 18:51:29.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I17601d56b6e6d9d300bb07d8982a7bbde637822e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-06-06 18:55:00.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like

Change-Id: I17601d56b6e6d9d300bb07d8982a7bbde637822e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-06-06 20:18:44.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Decode the output of subprocess in doc/source/conf.py so that we always
have a string.

Change-Id: I17601d56b6e6d9d300bb07d8982a7bbde637822e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Decode the output of subprocess in doc/source/conf.py so that we always
have a string.

Change-Id: I17601d56b6e6d9d300bb07d8982a7bbde637822e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Restart API also when run with Apache

Restarting services only considers those with the "panko-service" tag.
So add it to the Apache service.

Change-Id: Ica16ce2adaef0617c687f9e8ac658b1082732c1f

subject: Add per-network routes to network_data.yaml and NIC templates
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'shardy@redhat.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 6681, 'name': 'Brent Eagles', 'email': 'beagles@redhat.com', 'username': 'beagles'}, {'_account_id': 12398, 'name': 'Dan Sneddon', 'email': 'dsneddon@redhat.com', 'username': 'dsneddon'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 17280, 'name': 'Tim Rozet', 'email': 'trozet@redhat.com', 'username': 'trozet'}, {'_account_id': 21909, 'name': 'Bob Fournier', 'email': 'bfournie@redhat.com', 'username': 'bfournie'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24245, 'name': 'Harald Jensås', 'email': 'hjensas@redhat.com', 'username': 'harald.jensas'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2018-06-07 11:04:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-06-07 11:59:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'd like to solve this a different way for routed networks. I have patches up for Neutron and Heat and Tripleo to allow us to read the routes required for routed networks from attributes on the neutron subnet resource. (I put some stuff in the spec a few weeks ago about this)

Still, I think it can be useful to allow the user to define routes in network_data.yaml.

Maby we can hold off on the network_data_routed example?"}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-06-07 13:52:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

We should add these host routes to the neutron subnet resources.
https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/network/network.j2#L85


We can use get_attr to get the host_routes here:
https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/master/puppet/role.role.j2.yaml#L416

{{network.name}}Routes: {get_attr: [{{network.name}}Subnet, subnets, 0, host_routes]}'}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2018-06-07 20:14:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Harald, the problem with reading the actual routes required from Neutron (rather than using a supernet in network_data.yaml) is that then every time you scale out you will need to update the routes on all the existing nodes. If you use a single supernet route instead of the actual routes of all the other networks, there is one route that gets installed and never changes. Think of the synchronization problems that could occur if adding the 15th rack required updating all routes on all nodes in 14 existing racks. That's what I'm trying to avoid by using supernet routes.

We can mitigate this somewhat if we modify os-net-config to update routes without bouncing interfaces, but then we still have the impact (and potential problems) involved in running os-net-config on every node when you scale out a new set of networks.

Eventually we may want to move to dynamic routing, and at that time we won't need to maintain static routes because new networks would be inserted into the dynamic routing automatically."}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2018-06-07 20:15:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2018-06-07 20:23:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Harald, one other thing to consider is that Neutron doesn't know that, e.g. InternalApi, InternalApi1, and InternalApi2 are part of the same logical network, so it won't be able to automatically determine which routes need to be applied to an interface to speak to similar networks over the local gateway."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-06-08 08:37:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

> Harald, the problem with reading the actual routes required
 > from Neutron (rather than using a supernet in network_data.yaml)
 > is that then every time you scale out you will need to update the
 > routes on all the existing nodes. If you use a single supernet
 > route instead of the actual routes of all the other networks,
 > there is one route that gets installed and never changes. Think of
 > the synchronization problems that could occur if adding the 15th
 > rack required updating all routes on all nodes in 14 existing racks.
 > That's what I'm trying to avoid by using supernet routes.

We should still store that supernet route as a host_route in neutron.
Currently neutron does not add any host routes for routed networks at all. I have this patch up for review to do that: https://review.openstack.org/570405 . This still needs some work. For now it would not create a route if the user specified a route with the same 'destination'. I could make it calculate so that it would not add a route if the user provided a supernet with a destination that includes the different networks as well. 

Yes, the supernet routes does work for a controlled environment where a large network where set aside for this. But I am worrited for the edge usecase of the telco industry. This is not going to work for them.

What worries me here is that we add these routes without also adding them in neutron. Besides that I think it is a good addition to network_data.yaml. Allowing the user to specify host_routes can be useful also for non-routed deployments. For example if backup/monitoring server is via a different router etc.

You see how we could still use supernet routes while reading the host_routes attribute of the subnet. And then be ready to use routes put into the host_routes field for routed networks by neutron when that becomes available.


 > We can mitigate this somewhat if we modify os-net-config to update
 > routes without bouncing interfaces, but then we still have the impact
 > (and potential problems) involved in running os-net-config on every
 > node when you scale out a new set of networks.

I would really like for us to re-open the patch you wrote for os-net-config to do this. It had positive reviews, but was then abandoned due to process because of lack of update. If we had that patch we could enable os-net-config on updates. Or document to do it optionally when a supernet is not flexible enough. We may even add and option to os-net-config to allow it to only do ifroute-down/ifroute-up. (Even only ifroute-up would be enough to add new routes added in the network-scripts/routes-<dev> files.)


 > Harald, one other thing to consider is that Neutron doesn't know
 > that, e.g. InternalApi, InternalApi1, and InternalApi2 are part of
 > the same logical network, so it won't be able to automatically
 > determine which routes need to be applied to an interface to speak
 > to similar networks over the local gateway.

Which is why I want to migrate to 1 network with > 1 subnets and convert to a routed network. I have tested this, and it will be possible. The following two gerrit reviews for Heat.
https://review.openstack.org/567206
https://review.openstack.org/567207



Another reason to put the routes into neutron is that people are looking to use triplo do deploy things that are not openstack. They may decide to use DHCP instead of os-net-config. If we put the host_routes into the neutron subnet things will just work for that usecase. And I don't see why it would be negative for our os-net-config usecase."}, {'account_id': 12398, 'date': '2018-06-13 21:17:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

> We should still store that supernet route as a host_route in neutron.

Is there a way to do this via Heat? I think we'd need to think about this some more. Remember that since OSP 7 we have basically just used Neutron as an IPAM, and didn't use any of the other features of Neutron. I'm not sure how we would get from a list of networks in network_data.yaml to a list of host routes. In order for us to even do that, we would need to know which networks are related to which other networks. Otherwise, how do we know which routes should be used?

For example, let's say we have a customer with a main site that uses the normal networks (InternalAPI, Storage, External, CustomBM, etc.). Now they set up an edge site, with has custom networks (EdgeCExt, EdgeCSAN, EdgeCAPI, EdgeCIronic). It may be obvious to you which are related, but how would our templates know? We would have to set up some sort of a map inside network_data.yaml, which would complicate things, and then somehow enter those as host_routes inside Neutron.

Then, we need to get those routes back out of Neutron and into the os-net-config config.json, since Neutron usually publishes those routes via DHCP and we are using static IPs and routes.

> Currently neutron does not add any host routes for routed networks at all. I have this patch up 
> for review to do that: https://review.openstack.org/570405 . This still needs some work. For 
> now it would not create a route if the user specified a route with the same 'destination'. I could 
> make it calculate so that it would not add a route if the user provided a supernet with a 
> destination that includes the different networks as well. 

Although I think the supernet approach is clean and easy, I do recognize that there will be times when that doesn't work. That's why this patch uses a generic "routes" list, rather than a single input for a supernet.

> Yes, the supernet routes does work for a controlled environment where a large network where 
> set aside for this. But I am worrited for the edge usecase of the telco industry. This is not 
> going to work for them.

It doesn't have to be a supernet in this patch, it could be a list of routes to anywhere. If an operator didn't use supernets, they would need to enter a route to each of the other related networks rather than a single supernet.

> 
> What worries me here is that we add these routes without also adding them in neutron. 
> Besides that I think it is a good addition to network_data.yaml. Allowing the user to specify 
> host_routes can be useful also for non-routed deployments. For example if backup/monitoring 
> server is via a different router etc.

I think this patch does allow that, since the list of routes can be arbitrary.

> 
> You see how we could still use supernet routes while reading the host_routes attribute of the 
> subnet. And then be ready to use routes put into the host_routes field for routed networks by 
> neutron when that becomes available.

We would still need to come up with some mechanism to not only put routes into Neutron, but to somehow extract those routes and add them to the os-net-config network_config.

>  > We can mitigate this somewhat if we modify os-net-config to update
>  > routes without bouncing interfaces, but then we still have the impact
>  > (and potential problems) involved in running os-net-config on every
>  > node when you scale out a new set of networks.
> 
> I would really like for us to re-open the patch you wrote for os-net-config to do this. It had 
> positive reviews, but was then abandoned due to process because of lack of update. If we had 
> that patch we could enable os-net-config on updates. Or document to do it optionally when a 
> supernet is not flexible enough. We may even add and option to os-net-config to allow it to 
> only do ifroute-down/ifroute-up. (Even only ifroute-up would be enough to add new routes 
> added in the network-scripts/routes-<dev> files.)

Agreed, I think this is a good long-term approach. I'm not sure it should be the first step. Anything we do in os-net-config is going to have to be refactored soon anyway, since init-scripts are going away and we will need to use an API interface to NetworkManager. Eventually I would love to see dynamic routing so we don't have os-net-config doing the routes.

>  > Harald, one other thing to consider is that Neutron doesn't know
>  > that, e.g. InternalApi, InternalApi1, and InternalApi2 are part of
>  > the same logical network, so it won't be able to automatically
>  > determine which routes need to be applied to an interface to speak
>  > to similar networks over the local gateway.
> 
> Which is why I want to migrate to 1 network with > 1 subnets and convert to a routed network. 
> I have tested this, and it will be possible. The following two gerrit reviews for Heat.
> 
> https://review.openstack.org/567206
> https://review.openstack.org/567207

That would solve the problem of relating networks to one another so we know what should be routed where.

> 
> Another reason to put the routes into neutron is that people are looking to use triplo do deploy 
> things that are not openstack. They may decide to use DHCP instead of os-net-config. If we 
> put the host_routes into the neutron subnet things will just work for that usecase. And I don't 
> see why it would be negative for our os-net-config usecase.

The negative is the risk associated with modifying os-net-config/config.json and running os-net-config more often. If anything goes wrong with that, then the whole deployment could go down during a simple scale-out. I'm open to considering other options, but I don't think we can implement a whole new model (>1 subnet per network) in time for the Rocky cycle.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-06-14 13:45:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > > We should still store that supernet route as a host_route in
 > neutron.
 > 
 > Is there a way to do this via Heat? I think we'd need to think
 > about this some more. Remember that since OSP 7 we have basically

 > for us to even do that, we would need to know which networks are

 > routes should be used?

We can't do any calculations to figure out what the supernet route should be.
But adding the route as a host_route property on the neutron subnet we can do by using the host_route property for OS::Neutron::Subnet resource[1]. 


 > For example, let's say we have a customer with a main site that
 > uses the normal networks (InternalAPI, Storage, External, CustomBM,

Once we do, my changes[2]\xa0in neutron to calculate routes, will ensure we have the routes in the subnets host_route property already.

 > Then, we need to get those routes back out of Neutron and into the
 > os-net-config config.json, since Neutron usually publishes those

We can do that using get_attr. The same way we get "ip_netmask".
I have a THT review[3] up to get properties for the ctlplane interface. It get's the subnet CIDR prefixlen and the default route for now.
I want to follow up with another change to get the EC2Metadata route which we store in host_routes on the ctlplane network + the routes to the other leafs.

 > > Currently neutron does not add any host routes for routed

+1

Yes, I see that. But +1 to keep it a supernet route as is in the example routed_network_data.yaml in this change.

 > >

 > adding them in neutron.

Yes, we use get_attr to get the subnets attr[4] of the port. The same way we use get_attr to read ip_netmask from the port resource.
{{network.name}}Routes: {get_attr: [{{network.name}}Subnet, subnets, 0, host_routes]}

 > >  > We can mitigate this somewhat if we modify os-net-config to
 > update
 > >  > routes without bouncing interfaces, but then we still have the

 > > added in the network-scripts/routes-<dev> files.)
 > 
 > Agreed, I think this is a good long-term approach. I'm not sure it
 > should be the first step. Anything we do in os-net-config is going
 > to have to be refactored soon anyway, since init-scripts are going
 > away and we will need to use an API interface to NetworkManager.
 > Eventually I would love to see dynamic routing so we don't have
 > os-net-config doing the routes.

Agreed.

 > >  > Harald, one other thing to consider is that Neutron doesn't

 > gerrit reviews for Heat.

 > > https://review.openstack.org/567207

 > we know what should be routed where.

 > >

 > looking to use triplo do deploy
 > > things that are not openstack. They may decide to use DHCP
 > instead of os-net-config. If we
 > > put the host_routes into the neutron subnet things will just work
 > for that usecase. And I don't
 > > see why it would be negative for our os-net-config usecase.
 > 
 > The negative is the risk associated with modifying
 > os-net-config/config.json and running os-net-config more often. If
 > anything goes wrong with that, then the whole deployment could go
 > down during a simple scale-out. I'm open to considering other
 > options, but I don't think we can implement a whole new model (>1
 > subnet per network) in time for the Rocky cycle.

That is only negative if we keep changeing the host route. If we put a supernet route into the host_route property of the subnet, then we won't make any changes to os-net-config/config.json on updates.

Changing the routes would'nt work great for DHCP client either, as they would'nt pick up the new routes before the client does renewal ... unless someone goes and add's rfc3203 support.

So in either situation, using a supernet route is good. But how this is currently implemented we would'nt support a dhcp usecase, only the os-net-config usecase. We can support both.


Yes, completing the (>1 > subnet per network) in time for the Rocky cycle is not likely. (But I think not putting thise route into the host_route property of the subnets, and reading it from the subnet will complicate that work further down the line.)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-07 11:04:03.000000000', 'message': "Add per-network routes to network_data.yaml and NIC templates

This change adds a new routes field to the network definition in
network_data.yaml. This field contains a list of network routes
in JSON, e.g. [{'ip_netmask':'10.0.0.0/16','next_hop':'10.0.0.1'}].
This list is used to create parameters for each route in the NIC
config templates, and add each route to the network.

These routes can be used with routed spine-and-leaf networking,
where the routes applied to each network isolate traffic to that
particular network. For instance, if Internal API networks are
/24 networks inside one /16 supernet, then a route to the supernet
can be applied to each Internal API network. That way any traffic
sent from one host to a remote Internal API network will use the
local Internal API network gateway to send the traffic.

This change implements the tripleo-routed-networks-templates spec.

Change-Id: Id84097145293b32f22ff0bbe8ba73a7f4e89ff89
Implements: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates
"}]
commit_message:
Add per-network routes to network_data.yaml and NIC templates

This change adds a new routes field to the network definition in
network_data.yaml. This field contains a list of network routes
in JSON, e.g. [{'ip_netmask':'10.0.0.0/16','next_hop':'10.0.0.1'}].
This list is used to create parameters for each route in the NIC
config templates, and add each route to the network.

These routes can be used with routed spine-and-leaf networking,
where the routes applied to each network isolate traffic to that
particular network. For instance, if Internal API networks are
/24 networks inside one /16 supernet, then a route to the supernet
can be applied to each Internal API network. That way any traffic
sent from one host to a remote Internal API network will use the
local Internal API network gateway to send the traffic.

This change implements the tripleo-routed-networks-templates spec.

Change-Id: Id84097145293b32f22ff0bbe8ba73a7f4e89ff89
Implements: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates

commit_message:
Add per-network routes to NIC templates

This change adds a new {{network.name}}InterfaceRoutes
parameter to network config templates. It takes a list
of routes i.e:
  [{'destination':'10.0.0.0/16', 'nexthop':'10.0.0.1'}]

Co-Authored-By: Harald Jensås <hjensas@redhat.com>
Partial: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates
Depends-On: Ifc5aad7a154c33488a7613c8ee038c92ee6cb1a7
Change-Id: I90aea46d3addab9792c7c9d4feff5c5f61520b9b

commit_message:
Generate and mount wrappers for haproxy in OVN metadata agent

OVN metadata agent uses haproxy as part of its implementation.
Running it in a separate container prevents dataplane breakages
(ie. restarting VMs or spawning new ones) on agent restart/stop.
This patch triggers the creation of such sidecar container and
mounting of haproxy wrapper for spawning it in a separate
container.

Conflicts:
    docker/services/ovn-metadata.yaml
    puppet/services/docker.yaml

Change-Id: I59e08384080cda0b6c0f03c9ed8fb6f6a5661e6b
Related-Bug: #1749209
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry-picked from commit 662814ed1c121a7177c95b4a774d1c1fae686087)

commit_message:
Calculate TOCI_JOBTYPE from individual variables

Composing bash env var TOCI_JOBTYPE from the job invidual variables
allow as to remove the redudant ansible variable toci_jobtype from jobs.

We cannot remove TOCI_JOBTYPE since collect-logs role is using it [1] (to
generate reproducer) and it's called without playbook within a generated
bash script, so major refactoring is needed to pass the new individual
variables to it.

http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/tree/roles/collect-logs/tasks/publish.yml#n76

Change-Id: I593b989151fa70e1b5b6d2da75027529b0b911cd

commit_message:
Add host routes to subnets

This change adds a new routes field to the network
definition in network_data.yaml. This field contains
a list of network routes in JSON, e.g.
  [{'destination':'10.0.0.0/16','nexthop':'10.0.0.1'}].

This list is used to set the ``host_routes`` property
of each networks subnet.

Co-Authored-By: Dan Sneddon <dsneddon@redhat.com>
Partial: blueprint tripleo-routed-networks-templates
Depends-On: Ifc5aad7a154c33488a7613c8ee038c92ee6cb1a7
Change-Id: I33b34f1445f4203fbf25edeb093b37c7494c664f

commit_message:
[WIP] Adopt neutron-lib test base class

The most prevalent import of neutron in neutron-fwaas is "from
neutron.tests import base".  Exchange that with the neutron-lib version,
which is currently named '_base'.

Change-Id: Ifd0d7ea0782c096c68008fa3dcb82319485ed43c
