commit_message:
Create get_flattened_parameters workflow

The 'tripleo.parameters.get_flatten' action is called directly
as an action in tripleo-ui and should instead be called via a
workflow.

This code create the related workflow that will be used instead
of the action

Change-Id: I2b560dc084f54042598b72c9c3280ccfa2a4181a
Fixes-bug: #1759413

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-27 12:39:29.000000000', 'message': "OVN: Set sysctl value 'net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind' to 1

When OVN DBs pacemaker bundle is started on the controller nodes,
all the ovsdb-servers are configured to listen on the virtual ip
(on ports 6641/6642). But only master node is configured with virtual ip.
On the other nodes, we see the below error messages

ovsdb_jsonrpc_server|ERR|ptcp:6641:172.17.1.18: listen failed: Cannot assign
requested address.

The commit [1] addressed this issue in puppet-tripleo by setting the
sysctl value 'net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind' to 1 using puppet's sysctl::value.
But the ovn-dbs.yaml service file is missing this puppet tag when the
container 'ovn_dbs_init_bundle' is started.

We can fix the issue by defining this tag, but this also requires setting
'privileged=true' when starting the docker container.

Instead, this patch makes use of the t-h-t param 'KernelIpNonLocalBind'
which was introduced in this commit [2].

[1] - I6f762534350a3f96696c87ccd2d14545dccc8a0b
[2] - Idd3d432b8f7eb573d94cd56be8e05614510ebddf

Change-Id: I5ae8cd368bcd58810b18e172ee685fdbf0e48d98
Closes-bug: #1781585
(cherry picked from 5ed628f3534718dd61b66d4438fd8b33fa1362f8)
Conflicts:
    environments/neutron-ml2-ovn-dvr-ha.yaml
    environments/neutron-ml2-ovn-ha.yaml
"}, {'created': '2018-08-13 07:54:22.000000000', 'message': "OVN: Set sysctl value 'net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind' to 1

But the ovn-dbs.yaml service file is missing this puppet tag when the
container 'ovn_dbs_init_bundle' is started.

We can fix the issue by defining this tag, but this also requires setting
'privileged=true' when starting the docker container.

Instead, this patch makes use of the t-h-t param 'KernelIpNonLocalBind'
which was introduced in this commit [2].

[1] - I6f762534350a3f96696c87ccd2d14545dccc8a0b

commit_message:
OVN: Set sysctl value 'net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind' to 1

When OVN DBs pacemaker bundle is started on the controller nodes,
all the ovsdb-servers are configured to listen on the virtual ip
(on ports 6641/6642). But only master node is configured with virtual ip.
On the other nodes, we see the below error messages

ovsdb_jsonrpc_server|ERR|ptcp:6641:172.17.1.18: listen failed: Cannot assign
requested address.

The commit [1] addressed this issue in puppet-tripleo by setting the
sysctl value 'net.ipv4.ip_nonlocal_bind' to 1 using puppet's sysctl::value.
But the ovn-dbs.yaml service file is missing this puppet tag when the
container 'ovn_dbs_init_bundle' is started.

We can fix the issue by defining this tag, but this also requires setting
'privileged=true' when starting the docker container.

Instead, this patch makes use of the t-h-t param 'KernelIpNonLocalBind'
which was introduced in this commit [2].

[1] - I6f762534350a3f96696c87ccd2d14545dccc8a0b
[2] - Idd3d432b8f7eb573d94cd56be8e05614510ebddf

Change-Id: I5ae8cd368bcd58810b18e172ee685fdbf0e48d98
Closes-bug: #1781585
(cherry picked from 5ed628f3534718dd61b66d4438fd8b33fa1362f8)
Conflicts:
    environments/neutron-ml2-ovn-dvr-ha.yaml
    environments/neutron-ml2-ovn-ha.yaml

commit_message:
fix mistral client failure

when project_name and project_id are provided at the same time,
mistral client will ignore project_name, and if username and user_id
are provided at the same time, username will be ignored.

Change-Id: Ice720cafceb4904c218122c558c06346e9031650
Closes-Bug: #1785453

commit_message:
Add server schema for microversion 2.57

This commit adds servers schema for microversion 2.57
Without those schema in this file, get_schema() method
will throw error about particular schema not found in this file.

Change-Id: Ib5a9886bff2f0c7d8ba5be413703cf2eb39fc9d1

commit_message:
Delete python-ceilometerclient

python-ceilometerclient has been retired[1]. osprofiler[2] and
mistral[3] also no longer require it.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/522183
[2] https://review.openstack.org/532903
[3] https://review.openstack.org/532610

Change-Id: Ib185eaab938b9342d07f509b33c8d5b74cc3ce59

switch documentation job to new PTI

This is a mechanically generated patch to switch the documentation
jobs to use the new PTI versions of the jobs as part of the
python3-first goal.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-10 16:28:21.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Iba06a743bdf5324d84a4c1b9e8be7fb681292618
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Iba06a743bdf5324d84a4c1b9e8be7fb681292618

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I7deacb2fdec623b9ad120eb47330551264e17515
Story: #2003250

[{'created': '2018-08-14 15:34:31.000000000', 'message': "Add important note about the TLS everywhere settings

A lot of folks have been making mistakes when configuring TLS
everywhere, putting the options in groups where they don't belong.
Therefore I think it's relevant to warn them explicitly in the docs.

Change-Id: Ied8f62d2285444b60d07fee8d0cf348ce9e07b43
"}]
commit_message:
Add important note about the TLS everywhere settings

A lot of folks have been making mistakes when configuring TLS
everywhere, putting the options in groups where they don't belong.
Therefore I think it's relevant to warn them explicitly in the docs.

Change-Id: Ied8f62d2285444b60d07fee8d0cf348ce9e07b43

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-13 06:20:04.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "libvirt: slow live-migration to ensure network is ready"

This reverts commit 8e6d5d404cf49e5b68b43c62e7f6d7db2771a1f4.

As detailed in the bug, this is overly racy, waiting for the event
potentially a long ways (and a couple RPC calls) away from where
the event will be triggered. The compute manager now has a generic
mechanism to do this which conflicts and replaces this functionality,
if enabled (default is off in Rocky, to be defaulted to on in Stein).

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py
	nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

Change-Id: Ibf2b5eeafd962e93ae4ab6290015d58c33024132
Closes-Bug: #1786346
(cherry picked from commit 411c45842f6b4bef21710b4d7fa2f473976bc566)
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "libvirt: slow live-migration to ensure network is ready"

This reverts commit 8e6d5d404cf49e5b68b43c62e7f6d7db2771a1f4.

As detailed in the bug, this is overly racy, waiting for the event
potentially a long ways (and a couple RPC calls) away from where
the event will be triggered. The compute manager now has a generic
mechanism to do this which conflicts and replaces this functionality,
if enabled (default is off in Rocky, to be defaulted to on in Stein).

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py
	nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

Change-Id: Ibf2b5eeafd962e93ae4ab6290015d58c33024132
Closes-Bug: #1786346
(cherry picked from commit 411c45842f6b4bef21710b4d7fa2f473976bc566)

commit_message:
[ZFSOnLinux] Retry unmounting old datasets during manage

Add a retry loop to ensure the dataset being renamed
is cleanly unmounted before the rename operation.

Change-Id: Ie506f237010c415ee9f0d64abbefd5854f776a5f
Closes-Bug: #1785180

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I0d61c316f13b646ccbaa05d3715d66035184e1a7
Story: #2002586
Task: #24293

subject: Enable mutable config in searchlight
messages: [{'account_id': 16367, 'date': '2018-07-24 21:43:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7665, 'date': '2018-08-14 17:42:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-24 21:43:03.000000000', 'message': "Enable mutable config in searchlight

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
oslo.service provides an option here Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e
allows services to tell oslo.service they want mutate_config_files to be
called by passing a parameter.

This commit is to use the same. This allows searchlight to benefit from
I1e7a69de169cc85f4c09954b2f46ce2da7106d90, where the 'debug' option
(owned by oslo.log) is made mutable. we should be able to turn debug
logging on and off by changing the config.

tc goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/rocky/enable-mutable-configuration.html

Change-Id: I1c2833bef93b1382c7ddb71dba8621004dcd4cb1
"}]
commit_message:
Enable mutable config in searchlight

New releases of oslo.config support a 'mutable' parameter to Opts.
oslo.service provides an option here Icec3e664f3fe72614e373b2938e8dee53cf8bc5e
allows services to tell oslo.service they want mutate_config_files to be
called by passing a parameter.

This commit is to use the same. This allows searchlight to benefit from
I1e7a69de169cc85f4c09954b2f46ce2da7106d90, where the 'debug' option
(owned by oslo.log) is made mutable. we should be able to turn debug
logging on and off by changing the config.

tc goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/rocky/enable-mutable-configuration.html

Change-Id: I1c2833bef93b1382c7ddb71dba8621004dcd4cb1

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I5e57994077795bcc25861a081ef114fa97e01bef

commit_message:
Add wsgi_processes and wsgi_threads to horizon init

The wsgi_processes and wsgi_threads needs to be configureable
from the horizon init class and then passed to horizon::wsgi::apache.

Change-Id: Ic428214d7c84d33272becdb3675252318e8fd1bd

commit_message:
Detailed help message for QoS max-burst-kbps value

For QoS rule type bandwidth-limit the max-burst-kbps value for ovs and
linuxbridge is suggested to be 80% of the maxkbps value, let's give a
detailed help message for the CLI user.
For details see https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/queens/admin/
config-qos.html#user-workflow

Change-Id: Ia6e38ec7052b7af64880c2f4c5e242d7cb980df5
Closes-Bug: #1777866

- openstack-tox-py35: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1762876

Some of the tests failed in a way that we did not understand. Please help us classify these issues so that they can be part of Elastic Recheck http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-08-14 17:42:30.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Taking Jay's suggestion to go with an incremental approach, removing @safe_connect from one method at a time and handling ksa ClientException in the calling paths."}]

commit_message:
WIP/PoC: safe_connect shouldn't hide failures

An attempt to make safe_connect behave sanely. The changes are as
follows:

- When we recreate the client in response to EndpointNotFound, we retry
  the wrapped method after recreating the client session.
- We raise PlacementAPIConnectFailure (rather than implicitly returning
  None) when things go wrong.

Change-Id: I03a9c3960cc3e89b87a95c011049335109f38593

devstack for Barbican:

commit_message:
Add server schema for microversion 2.54

This commit adds servers schema for microversion 2.54
Without those schema in this file, get_schema() method
will throw error about particular schema not found in this file.

Change-Id: Ic56ba905ee314679705121742e3137de62bb233e
partially-implements: blueprint full-schema-for-all-microversions

[{'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2018-06-15 17:23:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2018-07-04 16:53:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2018-07-04 17:31:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-07-29 09:07:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

I suggest we add a functional test to do encrypt/decrypt using the keypair generated.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-07-31 06:24:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2018-08-02 13:12:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2018-08-02 13:25:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-08-02 23:06:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

Ade, what do you think of adding some functional test for this change?'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2018-08-07 16:08:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Lingxian, 

As for adding functional tests -- I'm not entirely sure how to do this.

Ideally, we could have add an actual vault gate just like we have for the barbican vault plugin.  This is something that we should do for Stein.  Until then, we'll have to rely on barbican testing."}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-08-07 23:27:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Lingxian,
 > 
 > As for adding functional tests -- I'm not entirely sure how to do
 > this.
 > 
 > Ideally, we could have add an actual vault gate just like we have
 > for the barbican vault plugin.  This is something that we should do
 > for Stein.  Until then, we'll have to rely on barbican testing.

Hi Ade, for the functional testing, I mean we call create_key_pair() to get the pair keys and encrypt something using the public key and make sure we could decrypt using the private key. Does that make sense?"}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-08-07 23:27:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Or do you prefer to do that in Barbican side?'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2018-08-08 17:52:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> > Lingxian,
 > >
 > > As for adding functional tests -- I'm not entirely sure how to do
 > > this.
 > >
 > > Ideally, we could have add an actual vault gate just like we have
 > > for the barbican vault plugin.  This is something that we should
 > do
 > > for Stein.  Until then, we'll have to rely on barbican testing.
 > 
 > Hi Ade, for the functional testing, I mean we call
 > create_key_pair() to get the pair keys and encrypt something using
 > the public key and make sure we could decrypt using the private
 > key. Does that make sense?

What is returned by create_key_pair() is a tuple of key references - not the actual keys.  The references only make sense if you have a vault backend to retrieve them ..

We should do functional tests here, but that requires setting up a vault gate similar to what we have set up for barbican.  That should be a priority for Stein.

For now, we will have indirect testing in the Brabican gate, where we test this scenario exactly."}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2018-08-09 11:05:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

thanks for your patience, Ade, I'm good to this patch now."}, {'account_id': 10873, 'date': '2018-08-09 15:58:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2018-08-10 14:32:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 9914, 'date': '2018-08-10 15:21:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Add pauch to the includepkgs

We gate paunch on tripleo so the latest version should be included
rather than using the promotion process.

commit_message:
Cannot update ssl certificate when update listener

Update listener success, but only the name and description of the
listener has been updated. Certificate remains same as old one.

Change-Id: Ic035e163a197d854337e9aa935dcb28d7289cc9c

Task: 6659

commit_message:
Add Sahara API WSGI support

Adds support for running the Sahara API under WSGI with Apache.
Ubuntu Bionic has removed support for eventlet which means you must
use WSGI now. See bug [1] [2]

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/sahara/+bug/1786214
[2] https://bugs.launchpad.net/puppet-sahara/+bug/1765453

Closes-Bug: 1765453
Change-Id: If035283b5880a49f34c5552fd2146d9653bd1e61

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-13 20:25:57.000000000', 'message': "Improve debug logs for GET /allocation_candidates

This patch trades off code terseness for clear and understandable debug
output in the main loop for GET /allocation_candidates. Here are some
examples of the output:

- A request for three resources with no aggregate or trait filters:

 found 7 providers with available 5 VCPU
 found 9 providers with available 1024 MEMORY_MB
       5 after filtering by previous result
 found 8 providers with available 1500 DISK_GB
       2 after filtering by previous result

- The same request, but with a required trait that nobody has, shorts
  out quickly:

 found 0 providers after applying required traits filter ({'HW_CPU_X86_AVX2': 65})

- A request for one resource with aggregates and forbidden (but no
  required) traits:

 found 2 providers after applying aggregates filter ([['3ed8fb2f-4793-46ee-a55b-fdf42cb392ca']])
 found 1 providers after applying forbidden traits filter ({u'CUSTOM_TWO': 201, u'CUSTOM_THREE': 202})
 found 3 providers with available 4 VCPU
       1 after applying initial aggregate and trait filters

Change-Id: I68687102e3fbd9f512ca65e9b0aa21b6b6cf5a9f
"}, {'created': '2018-08-14 15:35:46.000000000', 'message': "[placement] split gigantor SQL query, add logging

This patch modifies the code paths for the non-granular request group
allocation candidates processing. It removes the giant multi-join SQL
query and replaces it with multiple calls to
_get_providers_with_resource(), logging the number of matched providers
for each resource class requested and filter (on required traits,
forbidden traits and aggregate memebership).

Here are some examples of the debug output:

- A request for three resources with no aggregate or trait filters:

 found 7 providers with available 5 VCPU
 found 9 providers with available 1024 MEMORY_MB
       5 after filtering by previous result
 found 8 providers with available 1500 DISK_GB
       2 after filtering by previous result

- The same request, but with a required trait that nobody has, shorts
  out quickly:

 found 0 providers after applying required traits filter ({'HW_CPU_X86_AVX2': 65})

- A request for one resource with aggregates and forbidden (but no
  required) traits:

 found 2 providers after applying aggregates filter ([['3ed8fb2f-4793-46ee-a55b-fdf42cb392ca']])
 found 1 providers after applying forbidden traits filter ({u'CUSTOM_TWO': 201, u'CUSTOM_THREE': 202})
 found 3 providers with available 4 VCPU
       1 after applying initial aggregate and trait filters

Change-Id: I68687102e3fbd9f512ca65e9b0aa21b6b6cf5a9f
"}]
commit_message:
[placement] split gigantor SQL query, add logging

This patch modifies the code paths for the non-granular request group
allocation candidates processing. It removes the giant multi-join SQL
query and replaces it with multiple calls to
_get_providers_with_resource(), logging the number of matched providers
for each resource class requested and filter (on required traits,
forbidden traits and aggregate memebership).

Here are some examples of the debug output:

- A request for three resources with no aggregate or trait filters:

 found 7 providers with available 5 VCPU
 found 9 providers with available 1024 MEMORY_MB
       5 after filtering by previous result
 found 8 providers with available 1500 DISK_GB
       2 after filtering by previous result

- The same request, but with a required trait that nobody has, shorts
  out quickly:

 found 0 providers after applying required traits filter ({'HW_CPU_X86_AVX2': 65})

- A request for one resource with aggregates and forbidden (but no
  required) traits:

commit_message:
Change quota_class policy to admin only

This aligns the API behavior to nova, in which the default policy
for getting quota_class is:

  'is_admin:True or quota_class:%(quota_class)s'

Note: the 'quota_class' is unused [1] so this is effectively an
admin-only policy.

[1] https://lists.launchpad.net/openstack/msg12200.html

Change-Id: I5b436086c9594ae217f1a1de021d64e00ac05e38

can be used with both roles

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-14 16:00:50.000000000', 'message': "add pydot dependency

Is the library actively maintained?

   It appears that pydot has been updated more recently than pydot3,
   although neither seem particularly current.

Is the library good code?

   No idea.

Is the library python3-compatible?

   It claims support through python 3.7.

Is the library license compatible?

   Yes, MIT

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?

   Unknown. We've apparently been using it in taskflow for a while now,
   though.

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in
global-requirements.txt?

   We already have pydot3, but the version of networkx we are using does
   not like the version number of pydot3. We worked around that by
   placing the dependency in tox.ini, where the requirements check job
   didn't see it. This patch is meant to let us start managing the
   dependency properly.

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
infrastructure setup?

   Yes, taskflow uses it.

If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process does
it use the cycle-with-intermediary release type?

   This is not an OpenStack library.

Change-Id: I18bd5819b55a574eefd57c6550c4d09d422ac4f6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
add pydot dependency

Is the library actively maintained?

   It appears that pydot has been updated more recently than pydot3,
   although neither seem particularly current.

Is the library good code?

   No idea.

Is the library python3-compatible?

   It claims support through python 3.7.

Is the library license compatible?

   Yes, MIT

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?

   Unknown. We've apparently been using it in taskflow for a while now,
   though.

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries in
global-requirements.txt?

   We already have pydot3, but the version of networkx we are using does
   not like the version number of pydot3. We worked around that by
   placing the dependency in tox.ini, where the requirements check job
   didn't see it. This patch is meant to let us start managing the
   dependency properly.

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
infrastructure setup?

   Yes, taskflow uses it.

If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process does
it use the cycle-with-intermediary release type?

   This is not an OpenStack library.

Change-Id: I18bd5819b55a574eefd57c6550c4d09d422ac4f6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Use the TripleO Ansible role from tripleo-upgrade to run upgrades

We should use the Ansible role from tripleo-upgrade
to run upgrades. This submission removes the duplicated code
now living in the openstack/tripleo-upgrade repository.

Change-Id: Ia340d95126e91afcceca5b4ca1784408c37fb191

[{'created': '2018-08-09 18:16:34.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Iac82d0dc56ba59b8f9dc7dd66e250291b73ecee2
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Iac82d0dc56ba59b8f9dc7dd66e250291b73ecee2

This patch adds consistency group capability to generic volume group
in Lefthand driver. Re-use the CG implementations if it is a CG
type group. And if the group being created isn't a CG then we
bail out and the generic volume group will take care of it.

Implements: blueprint hpe-lefthand-generic-volume-group
Change-Id: Ib4b353331bad30e7296264542511b1d25a88cd0f
(cherry picked from commit 81ece6a9f2ac9b4ff3efe304bab847006f8b0aef)
"}]
commit_message:
HPE Lefthand: add CG capability to generic groups

This patch adds consistency group capability to generic volume group
in Lefthand driver. Re-use the CG implementations if it is a CG
type group. And if the group being created isn't a CG then we
bail out and the generic volume group will take care of it.

Implements: blueprint hpe-lefthand-generic-volume-group
Change-Id: Ib4b353331bad30e7296264542511b1d25a88cd0f
(cherry picked from commit 81ece6a9f2ac9b4ff3efe304bab847006f8b0aef)

This patch adds consistency group capability to generic volume group
in Lefthand driver. Re-use the CG implementations if it is a CG
type group. And if the group being created isn't a CG then we
bail out and the generic volume group will take care of it.

Implements: blueprint hpe-lefthand-generic-volume-group
Change-Id: Ib4b353331bad30e7296264542511b1d25a88cd0f
(cherry picked from commit 81ece6a9f2ac9b4ff3efe304bab847006f8b0aef)
"}]
commit_message:
HPE Lefthand: add CG capability to generic groups

This patch adds consistency group capability to generic volume group
in Lefthand driver. Re-use the CG implementations if it is a CG
type group. And if the group being created isn't a CG then we
bail out and the generic volume group will take care of it.

Implements: blueprint hpe-lefthand-generic-volume-group
Change-Id: Ib4b353331bad30e7296264542511b1d25a88cd0f
(cherry picked from commit 81ece6a9f2ac9b4ff3efe304bab847006f8b0aef)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-08 12:12:48.000000000', 'message': " apache wsgi: Exchange defaults for workers and threads

 Due to Python's GIL [1], we can't use multiple threads for running
 OpenStack services without a performance penalty, since the execution
 ends up serialized, which defeats the purpose.

 Instead, we should use several processes, since this approach doesn't
 have this limitation.

 See the same kind of change here [2]

 [1] https://wiki.python.org/moin/GlobalInterpreterLock
 [2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/505192/

Change-Id: I9c1ef8991d63b18a0ec106a05576b74ab457a2a0

"}, {'created': '2018-08-12 21:02:31.000000000', 'message': " apache wsgi: Exchange defaults for workers and threads

 OpenStack services without a performance penalty, since the execution
 ends up serialized, which defeats the purpose.

commit_message:
apache wsgi: Exchange defaults for workers and threads

 Due to Python's GIL [1], we can't use multiple threads for running
 OpenStack services without a performance penalty, since the execution
 ends up serialized, which defeats the purpose.

 Instead, we should use several processes, since this approach doesn't
 have this limitation.

 See the same kind of change here [2]

 [1] https://wiki.python.org/moin/GlobalInterpreterLock
 [2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/505192/

Change-Id: I9c1ef8991d63b18a0ec106a05576b74ab457a2a0

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Disable password auth on dib images""

This reverts commit 08a258c96bd090d5ddc3ba74a0da3c02330f1dc0.

Note the difference here is using all lower case for the options.  It
seems sshd is sensitive to the case.

Change-Id: Ide639491bcdedfb2ee8f76e8d0bfe83dde45805f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-10 18:34:37.000000000', 'message': 'Create virtualenv with '--never-download'

For upgrades, and some new build configurations, trying to
create a new venv results in the error:

Could not get output from /usr/bin/virtualenv --help: Traceback (most recent call last):
File "/usr/bin/virtualenv", line 6, in <module>
from pkg_resources import load_entry_point
ImportError: No module named pkg_resources

To work around this issue, we do the initial build of the
venv using the CLI with the argument '--never-download'
so that virtualenv just uses the versions of pip, setuptools
and wheel that it already has.

Change-Id: I639bc78d34b640a52c32fa175b12fa958518e999
(cherry picked from commit 46ae829b33acd38c6c3ce5fb5873d042195dedc3)
'}]
commit_message:
Create virtualenv with '--never-download'

For upgrades, and some new build configurations, trying to
create a new venv results in the error:

Could not get output from /usr/bin/virtualenv --help: Traceback (most recent call last):
File "/usr/bin/virtualenv", line 6, in <module>
from pkg_resources import load_entry_point
ImportError: No module named pkg_resources

To work around this issue, we do the initial build of the
venv using the CLI with the argument '--never-download'
so that virtualenv just uses the versions of pip, setuptools
and wheel that it already has.

Change-Id: I639bc78d34b640a52c32fa175b12fa958518e999
(cherry picked from commit 46ae829b33acd38c6c3ce5fb5873d042195dedc3)

commit_message:
Include microversion in OS_VOLUME_API_VERSION

Include Cinder's API microversion in OS_VOLUME_API_VERSION. This ensures
CLI tools have access to the latest Cinder features.

For Queens, the version is pinned at 3.50 per [1].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blame/master/cinder/api/openstack/rest_api_version_history.rst#L398

Closes-Bug: #1780287
Change-Id: I7528ae96577f8178ffaf3816f592980e95fb9dd8

how is this supposed to work if an update_router updates both of a flavor related attribute (say distributed) and an arbitrary attribute (say enable_snat) ?'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2018-01-30 03:35:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2018-01-30 03:43:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2018-01-30 04:35:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

regarding to changing both flavor related and other arbitrary attributes, basically it hits del_resource_associations and add_resource_association. So new flavor gets all the necessary attributes. old flavor gets removed.
Due to ordering of callback, l3 flavor driver has to subscribe (ROUTER, PRECOMMIT_UPDATE) at this point to catch change of attributes.

Later we need to investigate the ordering issue of (ROUTER, PRECOMMIT_UPDATE). For example to guarantee DriverController._update_router_provider is called last.'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2018-01-30 05:13:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 25.'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2018-01-30 06:16:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 26.'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2018-01-30 06:49:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 27.'}, {'account_id': 333, 'date': '2018-01-30 08:22:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-28 01:09:08.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: l3 flavor: add more events/notifications

ODL l3 flavor requires precommit callback. but
PRECOMMIT_CREATE/UPDATE/DELETE is already used by driver_controller.py.
So introduce more events so that l3 flavor driver can subscribe it.
This patch adds more necessary notifications for l3 flavor.
BEFORE_CREATE_DRIVER, PRECOMMIT_CREATE/DELETE_DRIVER and
PRECOMMIT_ADD/DEL_ASSOCIATION.

Change-Id: If20b11f0587f1ed30db72d97c15b20d4c6e87543

'}, {'created': '2018-01-09 00:55:39.000000000', 'message': 'l3 flavor: add more events/notifications

ODL l3 flavor requires precommit callback. but (ROUTER,
PRECOMMIT_CREATE/DELETE) is already used by driver_controller.py. so
introduce new resources and events to avoid conflict.

This patch adds more necessary notifications for l3 flavor,
resources(ROUTER_CONTROLLER and ROUTER_EXTRA_ROUTE) and
events(PRECOMMIT_ADD/DEL_ASSOCIATION) so that l3 flavor driver can
subscribe it. extra route needs care because extra route is updated via
update_router, but within different db transaction.

Co-Authored-By: Manjeet Singh Bhatia<manjeet.s.bhatia@intel.com>
Change-Id: If20b11f0587f1ed30db72d97c15b20d4c6e87543

this patch adds the necessary notifications for l3 flavor,
resource(ROUTER_CONTROLLER) and events(PRECOMMIT_ADD/DEL_ASSOCIATION) so
that l3 flavor driver can subscribe to them. extra routes need care
because they are updated via update_router, but within different db
transaction.

'}, {'created': '2018-02-07 02:05:17.000000000', 'message': "l3 flavor: add more events notifications

After the addition of a new resource and related events with [1],
this patch adds the necessary notifications for l3 flavor,
resource(ROUTER_CONTROLLER) and events(PRECOMMIT_ADD_ASSOCIATION and
PRECOMMIT_DELETE_ASSOCIATIONS) so that l3 flavor driver can subscribe to
them. extra routes/l3_gwmode/l3_hamode need care because they are
updated via update_router but within different db transaction.
Since extra attributes by l3_* are populated by (ROUTER,
PRECOMMIT_CREATE/UPDATE) via ExtraAttributesMixin.set_extra_attr_value.
The method can't emit (ROUTER, PRECOMMIT_UPDATE) to avoid cyclic
callback. So it notify (ROUTER_CONTROLLER, PRECOMMIT_UPDATE) instead.

[1] I1e72ee843851004d26410a90da4030ab3b024741

Closes-Bug: #1745633

Co-Authored-By: Manjeet Singh Bhatia<manjeet.s.bhatia@intel.com>
Change-Id: If20b11f0587f1ed30db72d97c15b20d4c6e87543
"}, {'created': '2018-02-09 01:17:04.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: l3 flavor: more events/notifications and callback priority

After the addition of a new resource and related events with [1],
this patch adds the necessary notifications for l3 flavor,
resource(ROUTER_CONTROLLER) and events(PRECOMMIT_ADD_ASSOCIATION and
PRECOMMIT_DELETE_ASSOCIATIONS) so that l3 flavor driver can subscribe to
them when flavor is changed.

Apply callback priority to ensure that the ordering of callback the
following.
- l3_*_db callbacks to extend l3 extended attributes
  This callbacks need to be called first so that rest callbacks can
  see those extended attributes.
- l3 driver controller callbacks
- l3 flavor driver callbacks
extra routes/l3_gwmode/l3_hamode need care because they are
updated via update_router but within different db transaction.

[1] I1e72ee843851004d26410a90da4030ab3b024741

Closes-Bug: #1745633

Co-Authored-By: Manjeet Singh Bhatia<manjeet.s.bhatia@intel.com>
Change-Id: If20b11f0587f1ed30db72d97c15b20d4c6e87543
Depends-On: Ib4fa951eabc184c9d175e32b1db4af68a836dc10

'}, {'created': '2018-04-28 00:01:32.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: l3 flavor: more events/notifications and callback priority

After the addition of a new resource and related events with [1],
this patch adds the necessary notifications for l3 flavor,
resource(ROUTER_CONTROLLER) and events(PRECOMMIT_ADD_ASSOCIATION and
PRECOMMIT_DELETE_ASSOCIATIONS) so that l3 flavor driver can subscribe to
them when flavor is changed.

Apply callback priority to ensure that the ordering of callback the
following.
- l3_*_db callbacks to extend l3 extended attributes
  This callbacks need to be called first so that rest callbacks can
  see those extended attributes.
- l3 driver controller callbacks
- l3 flavor driver callbacks
extra routes/l3_gwmode/l3_hamode need care because they are
updated via update_router but within different db transaction.

commit_message:
l3 flavor: more events/notifications and callback priority

After the addition of a new resource and related events with [1],
this patch adds the necessary notifications for l3 flavor,
resource(ROUTER_CONTROLLER) and events(PRECOMMIT_ADD_ASSOCIATION and
PRECOMMIT_DELETE_ASSOCIATIONS) so that l3 flavor driver can subscribe to
them when flavor is changed.

Apply callback priority to ensure that the ordering of callback the
following.
- l3_*_db callbacks to extend l3 extended attributes
  This callbacks need to be called first so that rest callbacks can
  see those extended attributes.
- l3 driver controller callbacks
- l3 flavor driver callbacks
extra routes/l3_gwmode/l3_hamode need care because they are
updated via update_router but within different db transaction.

[1] I1e72ee843851004d26410a90da4030ab3b024741

Closes-Bug: #1745633

Co-Authored-By: Manjeet Singh Bhatia<manjeet.s.bhatia@intel.com>
Change-Id: If20b11f0587f1ed30db72d97c15b20d4c6e87543
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541766/

commit_message:
Add doc/requirements.txt to releasenotes tox environment

Without these dependencies, the releasenotes build does not actually
work.

Change-Id: I0d10a6318045c9d9293a45a86799b5e85dbcc5b3

commit_message:
HPE Lefthand: add CG capability to generic groups

This patch adds consistency group capability to generic volume group
in Lefthand driver. Re-use the CG implementations if it is a CG
type group. And if the group being created isn't a CG then we
bail out and the generic volume group will take care of it.

Implements: blueprint hpe-lefthand-generic-volume-group
Change-Id: Ib4b353331bad30e7296264542511b1d25a88cd0f

commit_message:
Allow disabling dnssec-validation

This option may be helpful in a situation that upstream DNS servers do
not support DNSSEC, and BIND9 reports "Unable to fetch DNSKEY". For
production deployments, it's encouraged to keep DNSSEC enabled.

Change-Id: I1c28a65ff7d8063ada795b7b2e962fbfedc32c3d
Closes-Bug: #1784599

subject: Ensure Boolean Strings from the environment are treated correctly
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 12898, 'name': 'Tony Breeds', 'email': 'tony@bakeyournoodle.com', 'username': 'tonyb'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-01-17 03:28:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-01-19 06:14:55.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bug/1743679 to bp/multiarch-support'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-01-21 17:32:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This will work, but I'm not sure it's the right approach to fix it. How do we even end up with booleans converted to strings? I'm pretty sure oslo.config can return booleans, so maybe we do something incorrect later on, like convert all values with six.string_type?"}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-01-22 00:55:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> This will work, but I'm not sure it's the right approach to fix it.
 > How do we even end up with booleans converted to strings? I'm
 > pretty sure oslo.config can return booleans, so maybe we do
 > something incorrect later on, like convert all values with
 > six.string_type?

Yup that's basically it we use six.text_type() to convert the oslo.config options into a strings so we can pass it via environment variables[1,2,3].

We do use the same code path for a few other tools (ie os-refresh-config) so it possibly has a wider impact that I first thought.  I s'pose we could do pass an empty string if the config option is a bool and the value is false.  That needs a bigger audit and is a little more risky.



[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/instack-undercloud/tree/instack_undercloud/undercloud.py#n1229
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/instack-undercloud/tree/instack_undercloud/undercloud.py#n1371
[3] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/instack-undercloud/tree/instack_undercloud/undercloud.py#n550"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-01-22 10:14:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Oh, I totally forgot that we pass everything through an environment >_< Okay, let's go with this approach. One purely Python-related comment inline."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-01-23 02:40:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-01-25 07:02:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-01-28 17:23:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-01-29 06:37:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck

rechecking as logs have gone AWOL'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-01-30 06:04:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck

CI run failed'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-02-05 22:39:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-08-14 12:48:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/pike as commit d988d98e558ef5016fca14ecb10ed1664166b292'}]

commit_message:
Ensure Boolean Strings from the environment are treated correctly

This happens because we use six.text_type() to convert the oslo.config
options into a strings so we can pass it via environment
variables[1,2,3].

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/instack-undercloud/tree/instack_undercloud/undercloud.py#n1229
[2] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/instack-undercloud/tree/instack_undercloud/undercloud.py#n1371
[3] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/instack-undercloud/tree/instack_undercloud/undercloud.py#n550

Change-Id: I5830a856960856af1a045d6eda609b8abb20658d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-20 08:30:29.000000000', 'message': 'use callback payloads for PRECOMMIT_UPDATE events

This patch switches callbacks over to the payload object style events
[1] for PRECOMMIT_UPDATE based notifications. To do so a DBEventPayload
object is used with the publish() method to pass along the related data.
In addition a few UTs are updated to work with the changes. Finally
a few shims are put into place to allow PRECOMMIT_UPDATE based events to
use payloads while still supporting the existing kwarg style events.

NeutronLibImpact

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron-lib/latest/contributor/callbacks.html#event-payloads

Change-Id: Ie6d27df01cd7b87894efc80946d41eb1ebe25bef
(cherry picked from commit 537bfb9a1ca8490610bb96863b9fa7e417d65132)
'}]
commit_message:
use callback payloads for PRECOMMIT_UPDATE events

This patch switches callbacks over to the payload object style events
[1] for PRECOMMIT_UPDATE based notifications. To do so a DBEventPayload
object is used with the publish() method to pass along the related data.
In addition a few UTs are updated to work with the changes. Finally
a few shims are put into place to allow PRECOMMIT_UPDATE based events to
use payloads while still supporting the existing kwarg style events.

NeutronLibImpact

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron-lib/latest/contributor/callbacks.html#event-payloads

Change-Id: Ie6d27df01cd7b87894efc80946d41eb1ebe25bef
(cherry picked from commit 537bfb9a1ca8490610bb96863b9fa7e417d65132)

commit_message:
base: do not set $contentdir for CentOS

We no longer have to set $contentdir for CentOS as it is set in centos:7
images now.

This code was required when Docker hub had 7.4 images while 7.5 packages
were already in repositories.

Change-Id: I69d1b87ffb3af1dea2f8cf93a2264df93356e9ed

messages:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2018-08-13 18:24:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

package should also be removed in update tasks.'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2018-08-13 18:31:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2018-08-13 18:33:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2018-08-13 19:17:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2018-08-13 20:37:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2018-08-13 20:48:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

Obviously we'll be reviewing CI results."}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2018-08-14 00:09:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

the upgrades job timed out again on step 2, before getting to test the change but manual testing seems to indicate it works as intended

  (undercloud) [stack@undercloud test]$ more inventory.yaml
  ---
  - hosts: overcloud
    become: true
    gather_facts: no
    tasks:
    - name: Check if node is hosting a Ceph OSD
      # NOTE(gfidente): like we already do in
      # https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/stable/queens/extraconfig/tasks/pacemaker_common_functions.sh#L416-L419                                                                             
 
      command: pgrep -x httpd
      register: is_hosting_ceph_osd
      ignore_errors: True
    - name: Remove ceph-osd when possible
      yum: name=ceph-osd state=absent
      when:
      - is_hosting_ceph_osd.rc != 0
  (undercloud) [stack@undercloud test]$ more inventory.yaml
  overcloud:
    hosts:
      localhost'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2018-08-14 00:12:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> the upgrades job timed out again on step 2, before getting to test
 > the change but manual testing seems to indicate it works as
 > intended
 > 
 > (undercloud) [stack@undercloud test]$ more inventory.yaml
 > ---
 > - hosts: overcloud
 > become: true
 > gather_facts: no
 > tasks:
 > - name: Check if node is hosting a Ceph OSD
 > # NOTE(gfidente): like we already do in
 > # https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/stable/queens/extraconfig/tasks/pacemaker_common_functions.sh#L416-L419
 > 
 > command: pgrep -x httpd
 > register: is_hosting_ceph_osd
 > ignore_errors: True
 > - name: Remove ceph-osd when possible
 > yum: name=ceph-osd state=absent
 > when:
 > - is_hosting_ceph_osd.rc != 0
 > (undercloud) [stack@undercloud test]$ more inventory.yaml
 > overcloud:
 > hosts:
 > localhost

the above is testable on any undercloud with the following:

1) sudo yum -y install ceph-osd
2) ansible-playbook --inventory inventory.yaml playbook.yaml

ceph-osd is not removed because there are running httpd instances (note that the playbook is modified to check for httpd)

3) sudo killall httpd
4) ansible-playbook --inventory inventory.yaml playbook.yaml

observe ceph-osd is now removed'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2018-08-14 00:24:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Remove ceph-osd where not needed

This change adds an upgrade task which removes ceph-osd from nodes
not hosting a Ceph OSD and fixes the update_tasks so that on
subsequent updates all Ceph packages are updated.

Change-Id: Ic19174cdd19f481b7702296d91e21b89cdfac898
Related-Bug: #1785279

The association of `amqp.connected` flag to both `charms_openstack`
default handler and the charms own handler lead to intermittent
failure to restart `neutron-dynamic-routing` service on successful
completion of `amqp` relation.

Change-Id: Iefa1c4bf2a447b8c6126a417887512cc10a1b78e
Closes-Bug: #1784083
'}, {'created': '2018-08-05 07:53:50.000000000', 'message': 'Do not use default handler for `amqp.connected` flag

The charm provides its own handler for appearance of `amqp.connected`
flag.

Add workaround for intermittent test failures to functional test.

Depends-On: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza/pull/89
Closes-Bug: #1784083
Change-Id: Iefa1c4bf2a447b8c6126a417887512cc10a1b78e
'}]
commit_message:
Do not use default handler for `amqp.connected` flag

The charm provides its own handler for appearance of `amqp.connected`
flag.

Add workaround for intermittent test failures to functional test.

Depends-On: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza/pull/89
Closes-Bug: #1784083
Change-Id: Iefa1c4bf2a447b8c6126a417887512cc10a1b78e

commit_message:
Test validate-host role

Add validate-host to our zuul role integration job. This will allow us
to test changes to the validate host role and be more confident in
making those changes.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/563790
Change-Id: If2db235d143e3edace75db724928c9e482720b93

which licenses are used, and remove the redundant Features section.

messages:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-09 11:32:11.000000000', 'message': 'Support systemd nrpe check for ceph-osd@N units

ceph-osd<->nrpe relation adds a single check that parses the service
status of all the ceph-osd processes. The check supported sysv and
upstart environments, but not systemd, which has been added.

add_init_service_checks does support systemd but it would create a
nrpe check per OSD (vs a single check for all OSDs)

Change-Id: I19689740b4d95107c46435f56d808139c071b826
Closes-Bug: 1616525
Signed-off-by: Alvaro Uria <alvaro.uria@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Support systemd nrpe check for ceph-osd@N units

ceph-osd<->nrpe relation adds a single check that parses the service
status of all the ceph-osd processes. The check supported sysv and
upstart environments, but not systemd, which has been added.

add_init_service_checks does support systemd but it would create a
nrpe check per OSD (vs a single check for all OSDs)

Change-Id: I19689740b4d95107c46435f56d808139c071b826
Closes-Bug: 1616525
Signed-off-by: Alvaro Uria <alvaro.uria@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary parameter for looping

Currently the port is not used while looping in
_get_chassis_load_priority, so removing it from the loop.
If required, we can add it again in the future.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ie1a37c8ea1192bc5c8b186cb0d9695fe43e7919c

[{'created': '2018-08-13 13:06:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fix karbor-dashboard dependency

The horizon spec file correctly depends on python-django_compressor,
while karbor-dashboard was incorrectly using python-django-compressor.
This patch ensures they consistently use the correct package name.

'}]
commit_message:
Fix karbor-dashboard dependency

The horizon spec file correctly depends on python-django_compressor,
while karbor-dashboard was incorrectly using python-django-compressor.
This patch ensures they consistently use the correct package name.

Change-Id: I1ed3efcad2530ef6e60b7737ea3748b7d4a6ebb3

subject: Eliminate client race condition in convergence delete

[{'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-08-06 14:16:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-08-06 15:31:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-08-06 15:35:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Fixes a very annoying bug. Relatively low risk - just changes the point at which the call returns; the amount of work happening before that is comparable to other stack operations. Clean backport.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-08-08 15:06:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-08-09 08:18:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-06 14:16:54.000000000', 'message': "Eliminate client race condition in convergence delete

Previously when doing a delete in convergence, we spawned a new thread to
start the delete. This was to ensure the request returned without waiting
for potentially slow operations like deleting snapshots and stopping
existing workers (which could have caused RPC timeouts).

The result, however, was that the stack was not guaranteed to be
DELETE_IN_PROGRESS by the time the request returned. In the case where a
previous delete had failed, a client request to show the stack issued soon
after the delete had returned would likely show the stack status as
DELETE_FAILED still. Only a careful examination of the updated_at timestamp
would reveal that this corresponded to the previous delete and not the one
just issued. In the case of a nested stack, this could leave the parent
stack effectively undeletable. (Since the updated_at time is not modified
on delete in the legacy path, we never checked it when deleting a nested
stack.)

To prevent this, change the order of operations so that the stack is first
put into the DELETE_IN_PROGRESS state before the delete_stack call returns.
Only after the state is stored, spawn a thread to complete the operation.

Since there is no stack lock in convergence, this gives us the flexibility
to cancel other in-progress workers after we've already written to the
Stack itself to start a new traversal.

The previous patch in the series means that snapshots are now also deleted
after the stack is marked as DELETE_IN_PROGRESS. This is consistent with
the legacy path.

Change-Id: Ib767ce8b39293c2279bf570d8399c49799cbaa70
Story: #1669608
Task: 23174
(cherry picked from commit e63778efc91869efbd41e2f96b0c554aef1c80e5)

To prevent this, change the order of operations so that the stack is first

commit_message:
Eliminate client race condition in convergence delete

Previously when doing a delete in convergence, we spawned a new thread to
start the delete. This was to ensure the request returned without waiting
for potentially slow operations like deleting snapshots and stopping
existing workers (which could have caused RPC timeouts).

The result, however, was that the stack was not guaranteed to be
DELETE_IN_PROGRESS by the time the request returned. In the case where a
previous delete had failed, a client request to show the stack issued soon
after the delete had returned would likely show the stack status as
DELETE_FAILED still. Only a careful examination of the updated_at timestamp
would reveal that this corresponded to the previous delete and not the one
just issued. In the case of a nested stack, this could leave the parent
stack effectively undeletable. (Since the updated_at time is not modified
on delete in the legacy path, we never checked it when deleting a nested
stack.)

To prevent this, change the order of operations so that the stack is first
put into the DELETE_IN_PROGRESS state before the delete_stack call returns.
Only after the state is stored, spawn a thread to complete the operation.

Since there is no stack lock in convergence, this gives us the flexibility
to cancel other in-progress workers after we've already written to the
Stack itself to start a new traversal.

The previous patch in the series means that snapshots are now also deleted
after the stack is marked as DELETE_IN_PROGRESS. This is consistent with
the legacy path.

Change-Id: Ib767ce8b39293c2279bf570d8399c49799cbaa70
Story: #1669608
Task: 23174
(cherry picked from commit e63778efc91869efbd41e2f96b0c554aef1c80e5)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-06 16:28:01.000000000', 'message': "Adjust containerized logrotate config for hourly

Logrotate's copytruncate and hourly rotation is used by default for
puppet to configure containerized services logs rotation. Follow up
that in tht as well.

We do not want operators to deploy w/o copytruncate, as that represents
a poor choice with all containerized services including httpd running
in containers got reloaded hourly +/- a slight random splay applied
among all nodes in the cloud. So while that option exists in puppet, we
do not yet expose LogrotateCopytruncate for operators deploying via
t-h-t. It is still possible to overload that behavior via custom hiera
overrides env file though.

Change-Id: I7e8a771838967df07fa93e372d5151db782f8996
Related-Bug: #1785659
Depends-On: I15fa0eab1625ac63fd57b6a6d5cd22a6ac85f221
"}]
commit_message:
Adjust containerized logrotate config for hourly

Logrotate's copytruncate and hourly rotation is used by default for
puppet to configure containerized services logs rotation. Follow up
that in tht as well.

We do not want operators to deploy w/o copytruncate, as that represents
a poor choice with all containerized services including httpd running
in containers got reloaded hourly +/- a slight random splay applied
among all nodes in the cloud. So while that option exists in puppet, we
do not yet expose LogrotateCopytruncate for operators deploying via
t-h-t. It is still possible to overload that behavior via custom hiera
overrides env file though.

Change-Id: I7e8a771838967df07fa93e372d5151db782f8996
Related-Bug: #1785659
Depends-On: I15fa0eab1625ac63fd57b6a6d5cd22a6ac85f221

[{'created': '2018-08-06 16:08:59.000000000', 'message': "Fix containerized logrotate configuration

Use copytruncate and 'hourly' log rotation by default.  Increase the
default max number of rotated files to 336, which corresponds to 14
days, so that default period retained as is.

With the copytruncate option enabled, logs should be hourly rotated to
decrease disk IO load when copying log files around. The default
maxsize of 10M is better maintained for often rotations done within a
day as well, so log files will not happen to become unexpectedly huge
at the end of it.

W/o copytruncate, the containerized logrotate sends no signals to
processes, as files are only renamed and not unlinked. That makes the
files deletion based filter failing, until the default period of 14
days expires. To fix that non-copytruncate case, post-rotate always
sends HUP (USR1 for httpd) signals to all processes holding open files

reloaded hourly (there is still a random splay applied by cron though)
as a side effect.

With copytruncate ON, each rotation ensures the old log files will also be
deleted, so only affected services will be reloaded.

Additionally, send USR1 instead of HUP to reload httpd in containers
gracefully.

Closes-Bug: #1785659

Change-Id: I15fa0eab1625ac63fd57b6a6d5cd22a6ac85f221
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix containerized logrotate configuration

Use copytruncate and 'hourly' log rotation by default.  Increase the
default max number of rotated files to 336, which corresponds to 14
days, so that default period retained as is.

With the copytruncate option enabled, logs should be hourly rotated to
decrease disk IO load when copying log files around. The default
maxsize of 10M is better maintained for often rotations done within a
day as well, so log files will not happen to become unexpectedly huge
at the end of it.

W/o copytruncate, the containerized logrotate sends no signals to
processes, as files are only renamed and not unlinked. That makes the
files deletion based filter failing, until the default period of 14
days expires. To fix that non-copytruncate case, post-rotate always
sends HUP (USR1 for httpd) signals to all processes holding open files
in the /var/log/containers host path. That also makes all services
reloaded hourly (there is still a random splay applied by cron though)
as a side effect.

With copytruncate ON, each rotation ensures the old log files will also be
deleted, so only affected services will be reloaded.

Additionally, send USR1 instead of HUP to reload httpd in containers
gracefully.

Closes-Bug: #1785659

Change-Id: I15fa0eab1625ac63fd57b6a6d5cd22a6ac85f221
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix containerized logrotate configuration

Use copytruncate and 'hourly' log rotation by default.  Increase the
default max number of rotated files to 336, which corresponds to 14
days, so that default period retained as is.

With the copytruncate option enabled, logs should be hourly rotated to
decrease disk IO load when copying log files around. The default
maxsize of 10M is better maintained for often rotations done within a
day as well, so log files will not happen to become unexpectedly huge
at the end of it.

W/o copytruncate, the containerized logrotate sends no signals to
processes, as files are only renamed and not unlinked. That makes the
files deletion based filter failing, until the default period of 14
days expires. To fix that non-copytruncate case, post-rotate always
sends HUP (USR1 for httpd) signals to all processes holding open files
in the /var/log/containers host path. That also makes all services
reloaded hourly (there is still a random splay applied by cron though)
as a side effect.

With copytruncate ON, each rotation ensures the old log files will also be
deleted, so only affected services will be reloaded.

Additionally, send USR1 instead of HUP to reload httpd in containers
gracefully.

Closes-Bug: #1785659

Change-Id: I15fa0eab1625ac63fd57b6a6d5cd22a6ac85f221
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Adjust containerized logrotate config for hourly

Logrotate's copytruncate and hourly rotation is used by default for
puppet to configure containerized services logs rotation. Follow up
that in tht as well.

We do not want operators to deploy w/o copytruncate, as that represents
a poor choice with all containerized services including httpd running
in containers got reloaded hourly +/- a slight random splay applied
among all nodes in the cloud. So while that option exists in puppet, we
do not yet expose LogrotateCopytruncate for operators deploying via
t-h-t. It is still possible to overload that behavior via custom hiera
overrides env file though.

Change-Id: I7e8a771838967df07fa93e372d5151db782f8996
Related-Bug: #1785659
Depends-On: I15fa0eab1625ac63fd57b6a6d5cd22a6ac85f221
(cherry picked from commit b73b9ef37e252a4f922a94e7a1136eff332c2166)

[{'created': '2018-08-13 20:59:30.000000000', 'message': 'Increase default is ready retries

The current number of is ready retries does not work with DSS9000

to work.

Change-Id: I5651acbb22be1cffb2a7f448db6a6975d27ad963
'}]
commit_message:
Increase default is ready retries

The current number of is ready retries does not work with DSS9000
hardware.  This change doubles the number of retries, which has proven
to work.

Change-Id: I5651acbb22be1cffb2a7f448db6a6975d27ad963

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-13 16:09:37.000000000', 'message': "Disable password auth on dib images

Glean only configures key based authentication credentials. There is no
reason to allow password auth so disable it. This shouldn't be necessary
as no accounts allow password auth in /etc/shadow anyway but this gives
us security in layers like onions and ogres.

Change-Id: Ie17aa901eb3fe7387707a236287a3e880990eeb2
"}]
commit_message:
Disable password auth on dib images

Glean only configures key based authentication credentials. There is no
reason to allow password auth so disable it. This shouldn't be necessary
as no accounts allow password auth in /etc/shadow anyway but this gives
us security in layers like onions and ogres.

Change-Id: Ie17aa901eb3fe7387707a236287a3e880990eeb2

commit_message:
Switch to using stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr is maintained
project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch it then.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ifb460199c94d748988d4f0e836e90d1dd6f294bc
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-05 12:19:27.000000000', 'message': 'Fix tests.detection.test_mon

Static class variables of FakeProcesses class were used in all test
methods. These variables were used in an uncoordinated way causing tests
to fail ocassionally, depending on the grouping and ordering of the
tests in the worker processes.

Code has been refactored and instance variables are used now in all test
methods.

Change-Id: Ic87a00883dc6cff128809f24164d95eb8c98ae91
Story: 2002848
Task: 22797
'}, {'created': '2018-08-13 15:19:35.000000000', 'message': 'Fix tests.detection.test_mon

Code has been refactored and instance variables are used now in all test

commit_message:
Fix tests.detection.test_mon

Static class variables of FakeProcesses class were used in all test
methods. These variables were used in an uncoordinated way causing tests
to fail ocassionally, depending on the grouping and ordering of the
tests in the worker processes.

Code has been refactored and instance variables are used now in all test
methods.

Change-Id: Ic87a00883dc6cff128809f24164d95eb8c98ae91
Story: 2002848
Task: 22797

commit_message:
fix mistral dashbaord workflow execution form bug

fix a bug that when a workflow has no input params, execution form
will has a requried field with empty label

Close-bug:#1786723
Change-Id: I49b2125ef649e94e210ff5df739684626c175172

subject: blacklist bad versions of etcd3gw
messages:
[{'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-08-13 20:37:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-08-13 20:51:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-08-13 20:55:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

does this need to be done now?  should cause re-releases for the following.

+----------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------+------+----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| Repository                             | Filename                                               | Line | Text                                                                 |
+----------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------+------+----------------------------------------------------------------------+
| dragonflow                             | requirements.txt                                       |    7 | etcd3gw>=0.2.0 # Apache-2.0                                          |
| networking-calico                      | requirements.txt                                       |    9 | etcd3gw>=0.2.0 # Apache-2.0                                          |
| networking-spp                         | test-requirements.txt                                  |   17 | etcd3gw>=0.2.0 # Apache-2.0                                          |
| oslo.cache                             | doc/requirements.txt                                   |   11 | etcd3gw>=0.2.0 # Apache-2.0                                          |
| oslo.cache                             | setup.cfg                                              |   33 | oslo_cache.etcd3gw = oslo_cache.backends.etcd3gw:Etcd3gwCacheBackend |
| oslo.cache                             | setup.cfg                                              |   40 | etcd3gw =                                                            |
| oslo.cache                             | setup.cfg                                              |   41 | etcd3gw>=0.2.0 # Apache-2.0                                          |
| qinling                                | requirements.txt                                       |   32 | etcd3gw>=0.2.2 # Apache-2.0                                          |
| requirements                           | global-requirements.txt                                |  217 | etcd3gw  # Apache-2.0                                                |
| tooz                                   | setup.cfg                                              |   49 | etcd3gw =                                                            |
| tooz                                   | setup.cfg                                              |   50 | etcd3gw>=0.1.0 # Apache-2.0                                          |
| upstream-institute-virtual-environment | elements/upstream-training/static/tmp/requirements.txt |   46 | etcd3gw==0.2.1                                                       |
+----------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------+------+----------------------------------------------------------------------+

iirc, the only one we are concerned about in that list is oslo.cache, and tooz, not sure about qinling and don't think the networking things need to be worried about.

those re-releases would probably be only UC bumps, which would be fine

the alternative would be to wait for stable/rocky to be branched."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-08-13 21:10:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> does this need to be done now?  should cause re-releases for the
 > following.
 > 
 > +----------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------+------+----------------------------------------------------------------------+
 > | Repository                             | Filename                
 >                               | Line | Text                        
 >                                         |
 > +----------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------+------+----------------------------------------------------------------------+
 > | dragonflow                             | requirements.txt        
 >                               |    7 | etcd3gw>=0.2.0 # Apache-2.0 
 >                                         |
 > | networking-calico                      | requirements.txt        
 >                               |    9 | etcd3gw>=0.2.0 # Apache-2.0 
 >                                         |
 > | networking-spp                         | test-requirements.txt   
 >                               |   17 | etcd3gw>=0.2.0 # Apache-2.0 
 >                                         |
 > | oslo.cache                             | doc/requirements.txt    
 >                               |   11 | etcd3gw>=0.2.0 # Apache-2.0 
 >                                         |
 > | oslo.cache                             | setup.cfg               
 >                               |   33 | oslo_cache.etcd3gw =
 > oslo_cache.backends.etcd3gw:Etcd3gwCacheBackend |
 > | oslo.cache                             | setup.cfg               
 >                               |   40 | etcd3gw =                   
 >                                         |
 > | oslo.cache                             | setup.cfg               
 >                               |   41 | etcd3gw>=0.2.0 # Apache-2.0 
 >                                         |
 > | qinling                                | requirements.txt        
 >                               |   32 | etcd3gw>=0.2.2 # Apache-2.0 
 >                                         |
 > | requirements                           | global-requirements.txt 
 >                               |  217 | etcd3gw  # Apache-2.0       
 >                                         |
 > | tooz                                   | setup.cfg               
 >                               |   49 | etcd3gw =                   
 >                                         |
 > | tooz                                   | setup.cfg               
 >                               |   50 | etcd3gw>=0.1.0 # Apache-2.0 
 >                                         |
 > | upstream-institute-virtual-environment | elements/upstream-training/static/tmp/requirements.txt
 > |   46 | etcd3gw==0.2.1                                            
 >           |
 > +----------------------------------------+--------------------------------------------------------+------+----------------------------------------------------------------------+
 > 
 > iirc, the only one we are concerned about in that list is
 > oslo.cache, and tooz, not sure about qinling and don't think the
 > networking things need to be worried about.
 > 
 > those re-releases would probably be only UC bumps, which would be
 > fine
 > 
 > the alternative would be to wait for stable/rocky to be branched.

We aren't updating the minimum or any settings in those projects. Why would it trigger any re-releases?

We could wait to do the blacklisting until after we branch."}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-08-13 21:12:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I thought exclusions were still sync'd"}, {'account_id': 14288, 'date': '2018-08-13 21:12:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

s/synced/check-requirements fails without a sync'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-08-13 22:31:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> s/synced/check-requirements fails without a sync

No. As long as all of the exclusions in the project repo appear in the global list, the job considers the requirements compatible and allows it to pass.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2018-08-14 05:38:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

Change-Id: I4003fca955b9dcecbb6ba8b98b4b200079ea5b76
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
blacklist bad versions of etcd3gw

Both of these versions have the python3 encoding problem described in
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-August/133191.html

Change-Id: I4003fca955b9dcecbb6ba8b98b4b200079ea5b76
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

[{'account_id': 28290, 'date': '2018-05-22 04:24:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-05-22 04:25:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 28290, 'date': '2018-05-22 04:43:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 24441, 'date': '2018-06-06 01:26:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2018-06-06 14:19:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22582, 'date': '2018-06-06 15:16:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 9820, 'date': '2018-06-07 02:10:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 19779, 'date': '2018-06-07 10:20:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2018-06-08 01:53:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2018-08-13 08:38:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 28176, 'date': '2018-08-13 08:41:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7488, 'date': '2018-08-14 01:38:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23717, 'date': '2018-08-14 06:36:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

commit_message:
Use lbproxy instead of lbagent in neutron when deploy Octavia

Disable neutron-lbaas-agent and use lbaasv2-proxy  when enable octavia.
Use keystone-auth v3 and internal endpoint for lbaasv2 plugin.

Change-Id: I69e8436f3722cf99644457323b71b94dc9036bb9
Co-Authored-By: Hieu LE <hieulq2@viettel.com.vn>
Closes-Bug: #1756771
Closes-Bug: #1738115

 networking-odl 12.0.0 has requirement websocket-client<=0.40.0,>=0.33.0, but you'll have websocket-client 0.48.0 which is incompatible.

 neutron-dynamic-routing 12.0.1 has requirement eventlet!=0.18.3,!=0.20.1,<0.21.0,>=0.18.2, but you'll have eventlet 0.22.1 which is incompatible.

So lets block these in global-requirements to make things clear in Rocky
and then work on fixing at least the version caps in Stein.
