commit_message:
Exclude eventlet 0.22.0 and 0.24.0

Block the following releases:
eventlet-0.22.0.tar.gz                                 : 2018-01-12T00:07:40
eventlet-0.22.1.tar.gz                                 : 2018-02-17T18:12:57
eventlet-0.24.0.tar.gz                                 : 2018-08-01T17:27:52

We've been manually excluding these releases from upper-constraints and
we have OpenSTack libraries with old caps which are incompatible with
the newer releases.

For example:
 os-xenapi 0.3.3 has requirement eventlet!=0.18.3,!=0.20.1,<0.21.0,>=0.18.2, but you'll have eventlet 0.22.1 which is incompatible.
 neutron-lbaas 12.0.0 has requirement eventlet!=0.18.3,!=0.20.1,<0.21.0,>=0.18.2, but you'll have eventlet 0.22.1 which is incompatible.
 networking-sfc 6.0.0 has requirement eventlet!=0.18.3,!=0.20.1,<0.21.0,>=0.18.2, but you'll have eventlet 0.22.1 which is incompatible.
 os-win 4.0.0 has requirement eventlet!=0.18.3,!=0.20.1,<0.21.0,>=0.18.2, but you'll have eventlet 0.22.1 which is incompatible.
 jaeger-client 3.11.0 has requirement opentracing<2,>=1.2.2, but you'll have opentracing 2.0.0 which is incompatible.
 networking-odl 12.0.0 has requirement websocket-client<=0.40.0,>=0.33.0, but you'll have websocket-client 0.48.0 which is incompatible.
 neutron-fwaas 12.0.0 has requirement eventlet!=0.18.3,!=0.20.1,<0.21.0,>=0.18.2, but you'll have eventlet 0.22.1 which is incompatible.
 neutron 12.0.3 has requirement eventlet!=0.18.3,!=0.20.1,<0.21.0,>=0.18.2, but you'll have eventlet 0.22.1 which is incompatible.
 neutron-dynamic-routing 12.0.1 has requirement eventlet!=0.18.3,!=0.20.1,<0.21.0,>=0.18.2, but you'll have eventlet 0.22.1 which is incompatible.

So lets block these in global-requirements to make things clear in Rocky
and then work on fixing at least the version caps in Stein.

Change-Id: I93ee2167e6a5a06e4542e0edc870f60c2468edd4

commit_message:
Block opentracing 2.0.0

Currently jaeger-client doesn't work with 2.x so let block it for now.

jaeger-client 3.11.0 has requirement opentracing<2,>=1.2.2, but you'll have opentracing 2.0.0 which is incompatible.

Change-Id: I4cf85a91914de7d1f2092a91b68cd8c60e00fd29

commit_message:
Make use of service clients interface

This change makes use of features provided by stable "ServiceClients"
interface that has been available in Tempest for some time. The
interface enhances tests with a convenient way to access available
service clients.

When a plugin uses "ServiceClients" interface, all stable Tempest
clients and all clients exposed by installed plugins will be
automatically available and pre-configured. Instead of explicitly
specifying parameters, such as "auth_provider", "build_timeout", etc.,
all these parameters will be read from the Tempest configuration and
then installed automatically in the clients.

Plugin adaptation was carried out in accordance with the requirements
described in Tempest documentation[1] and inspired by changes introduced
in other plugins[2][3].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/tempest/latest/plugin.html#service-clients
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/338486/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/334596/

Change-Id: I0fbb12fb93f4411f23d95d54d8d5a7904a372333
Signed-off-by: Bartosz Zurkowski <b.zurkowski@samsung.com>

I thought about it for a moment and decided to look at the Tempest documentation again. The chapter on the design of plugins [1] clearly indicates that in case of only one available API version, the module structure should be flat:

 > The following folder and module structure is recommended for a single major API version:
 > 
 >  plugin_dir/
 >    services/
 >      __init__.py
 >      client_api_1.py
 >      client_api_2.py

commit_message:
Flatten service clients and tests directories

Looking at the structuring of service clients among Tempest plugins,
almost none of them places clients in "json" subfolder. Similarly,
almost none of the plugins places tests for different APIs into
individual directories such as: flavors, limits etc.. In particular,
such conventions do not occur in the Tempest repository, on which
plugins should be modeled.

This change reorganizes plugin directories in order to comply with
Tempest standards.

Change-Id: I7c967f70a10b9cab5d29c9d6b961f6e36d6eb600
Signed-off-by: Bartosz Zurkowski <b.zurkowski@samsung.com>

'}, {'created': '2018-07-22 18:48:32.000000000', 'message': 'Update policies for some port/router network tests

This patch set updates policies for some port/router network tests
to incorporate those that have recently been added to Neutron's
policy file (because they were missing):

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/577471/5

This includes updating relevant tests with the following policies:

* "create_port:fixed_ips"
* "update_port:fixed_ips"
* "create_router:external_gateway_info"

Also adds a new test for the following policy:

"create_router:external_gateway_info:network_id"

The approach taken is to create new feature flags for the new
policies and apply them to existing tests. This makes it easier
to maintain the tests but does result in the tests getting
skipped for previous releases of OpenStack that don't have
these "newer" policies. However, it is unlikely that policy
will be changed for older releases of OpenStack.

The alternative approach is [1] which leads to a lot of test
maintenance overhead: each combination of the set of all
the policies enforced per test needs to be accounted for
across n, n-1, and n-2, which is quite difficult to maintain.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/584102/5

Change-Id: I679fca4d10a0398cc66755ef428fa7b0bd77195d

commit_message:
Update policies for some port/router network tests

This patch set updates policies for some port/router network tests
to incorporate those that have recently been added to Neutron's
policy file (because they were missing):

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/577471/5

This includes updating relevant tests with the following policies:

* "create_port:fixed_ips"
* "update_port:fixed_ips"
* "create_router:external_gateway_info"

Also adds a new test for the following policy:

"create_router:external_gateway_info:network_id"

The approach taken is to create new feature flags for the new
policies and apply them to existing tests. This makes it easier
to maintain the tests but does result in the tests getting
skipped for previous releases of OpenStack that don't have
these "newer" policies. However, it is unlikely that policy
will be changed for older releases of OpenStack.

The alternative approach is [1] which leads to a lot of test
maintenance overhead: each combination of the set of all
the policies enforced per test needs to be accounted for
across n, n-1, and n-2, which is quite difficult to maintain.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/584102/5

Change-Id: I679fca4d10a0398cc66755ef428fa7b0bd77195d

project for the metadata-list command.

The trove command metadata-list is now:
    openstack database metadata list

commit_message:
Unable to specify compute node to run the containers

Implement a scheduler hint (i.e. force_hosts) for launching
containers on specified host.

Change-Id: Ifb2ed2aefdf1eae564cf94d98ec97aa005ee9ac6
Closes-bug: #1764236

subject: Stop running neutron-grenade job on api-ref changes
messages:
[{'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-02-09 08:07:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-02-09 10:35:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-02-10 08:58:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-02-11 05:28:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

yea, i agree with the point as there is no api-ref here.

Main issue is this job should not moved to neutron at first place. This is grenade job and shared by other project too. We discussed in QA meeting to move this to grenade repo.

I will fix the current issue as gibi mentioned to have separate set of irrelevant_files on project template side if that work.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-02-15 03:00:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

discussion on below mailing thread. Accordingly it will get fixed on nova side pipeline job list.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-February/127320.html 
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-February/127349.html'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-08-14 02:47:34.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

this issue is solved now with new zuul version where each project can override the irrelevant-files in their pipeline definition which will be taken over the irrelevant-files defined in base job or template.'}]

commit_message:
Stop running neutron-grenade job on api-ref changes

neutron-grenade job runs on nova gate also and it
run on api-ref only changes also which should not.
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/528201/20

Adding api-ref files in irrelevant-files list.

Change-Id: I1d0d6d9333689610c95a90355cd0468225500a8a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-07 18:49:46.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add cleanup services for neutron

Neutron used to run a neutron-ovs-cleanup and neutron-netns-cleanup
service on startup and shutdown to ensure a clean slate on startup and
properly "fence" nodes on shutdown. We need container specific versions
of these services because:

- The ordering dependencies of the baremetal versions of these services
are not correct for containerized deployments.

- neutron packages will not be installed on baremetal

NOTES: It might be tidierto separate the cleanups but where we are
brute forcing this anyways it might be simpler to combine them. Also the
reason for the separate shutdown services is that the the paunch
dependency ordering conflicts with what we need on startup.

Change-Id: Iddd191f06b0a7cadb463abec7ef152c89fddb3cd
'}, {'created': '2018-08-07 19:11:34.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add cleanup services for neutron

are not correct for containerized deployments.

- neutron packages will not be installed on baremetal

NOTES: It might be tidierto separate the cleanups but where we are

reason for the separate shutdown services is that the the paunch

commit_message:
Add cleanup service for neutron ovs bridges

Neutron used to run a neutron-ovs-cleanup service on startup and
shutdown to ensure clean configuration. Container specific version of
the cleanup service is needed as we are no longer installing neutron
packages in the overcloud image and the ordering dependencies of the
legacy services are not suitable for containerized neutron deployments.

Closes-Bug: #1786311

Change-Id: Iddd191f06b0a7cadb463abec7ef152c89fddb3cd

[{'created': '2018-08-09 23:34:58.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes ODL issue where OF port may be set wrong

There is a case where OVS needs to have the OpenFlow configuration
resynced. The regsubst was only replacing one of the ports instead of
all, so sometimes the OpenFlow controller settings on OVS would have
ports 6640 instead of the right port (6653).

Closes-Bug: 1786037

Change-Id: I93e3d355625508fdc42f44bdd358f3ba86fbd8d7
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 54188dbcf0046fc0baf70880653b899f6d10dc74)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes ODL issue where OF port may be set wrong

There is a case where OVS needs to have the OpenFlow configuration
resynced. The regsubst was only replacing one of the ports instead of
all, so sometimes the OpenFlow controller settings on OVS would have
ports 6640 instead of the right port (6653).

Closes-Bug: 1786037

Change-Id: I93e3d355625508fdc42f44bdd358f3ba86fbd8d7
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 54188dbcf0046fc0baf70880653b899f6d10dc74)

successfully.

subject: Use copy to get unchanged attributes in migrations schema
messages:
[{'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2018-07-30 08:51:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2018-07-30 09:11:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-30 14:36:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-08-07 09:23:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

We should not use more copy things anymore. Having raw schema are more strict testing and less error prone. I remember i started making the schema as raw and removing the copy things [1] because of 2 reasons
1. more readable to know the complete response of that version API from single place than keep iterating the base schema file

2. Less error prone. using copy is always risky. If there is any mistake in base schema or previous API version then that cannot be caught if we use copy. If we have raw schema then it is easy to compare the exact raw expected schema with response. One example of this case in nova request schema - https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1658571

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/306245/

But as i have not completed all the base schema to raw so i do not block any new schema as copy but we should not convert raw one to copy one.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-08-09 15:46:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

> We should not use more copy things anymore. Having raw schema are
 > more strict testing and less error prone. I remember i started
 > making the schema as raw and removing the copy things [1] because
 > of 2 reasons
 > 1. more readable to know the complete response of that version API
 > from single place than keep iterating the base schema file
 > 
 > 2. Less error prone. using copy is always risky. If there is any
 > mistake in base schema or previous API version then that cannot be
 > caught if we use copy. If we have raw schema then it is easy to
 > compare the exact raw expected schema with response. One example of
 > this case in nova request schema - https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1658571
 > 
 > [1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/306245/
 > 
 > But as i have not completed all the base schema to raw so i do not
 > block any new schema as copy but we should not convert raw one to
 > copy one.

I agree with 2. but not so much 1.

1. I don't think very long schemas are more readable. They are more readable in the sense that all the details are included. But succinctness in my opinion is what makes something more readable which is what zhufl does here.

2. I agree that using copy is more risky, because if there is a mistake in any of the previous microversions, then those mistakes are propagated forward into every other microversion that copies from the original one. This means that many microversions' schemas might be wrong, instead of just the original schema where the mistake is.

I think for Tempest (as a validation framework) 2. is much more important with 1. so I'm inclined to agree with gmann even if I don't really agree that complete schema is more readable. The other thing is that complete schemas are more work for Tempest team, but it's worth it to avoid errors in schemas."}, {'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2018-08-14 02:06:31.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Use copy to get unchanged attributes in migrations schema

This is to use copy to get unchanged attributes from previous
migrations schema, to make code clean and more readable.

Change-Id: I42b57d46e1105d24c4cd60c8dd5e45e772a82d5a

commit_message:
Allow wrap_member and wrap_collection to specify target

Allowing targeting of the types for wrap_member and wrap_collection.
This prevents the need to cross-call controllers such as wrapping role
refs fro the trust api.

Change-Id: Id8658cf6fba2fb765ec0f9b2265367741470f50e
Partial-Bug: #1776504

But, I still get duplicated log in both l2-agent.log and local_output_log_base.
This is the config:
[network_log]
rate_limit = 100
burst_limit = 25
local_output_log_base = /var/log/neutron/neutron_sec.log

So the ACCEPT or DROP log will show in both:
-rw-r--r-- 1 neutron neutron   9909 Aug  2 17:00 neutron_sec.log
-rw-r--r-- 1 neutron neutron   9909 Aug  2 17:00 openvswitch-agent.log
It's totally same. -1 for this duplicated log."}, {'account_id': 15471, 'date': '2018-08-02 09:12:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

commit_message:
Fix no packet log data when debug is set False in configuration

In production environment, it's quite difficult to require operator
to enable debug log level. This patch changes LOG.debug to LOG.info
of packet_in_handler function. Therefore operator can get packet log
data while debug=False or True in config file. This patch also adds
timestamp to log_file if local_output_log_base is specified.

Partial-Bug #1781372
Change-Id: I729e57caecd502d018084c3c766278006bcbf0c9

commit_message:
Remove keystone version in tacker.conf

Tacker is failing registering VIM monitoring
into mistral because the v3 in the auth url.

The auth url is being used auth_url + '/v3' in the code,
ending in a http://url:35357/v3/v3

https://github.com/openstack/tacker/blob/210d8f93bb5e7e179bff176d98d3079ab7f33ca0/tacker/nfvo/nfvo_plugin.py#L93


Change-Id: If5abbee1377ecdb2913a42bdfa77e7fbbfbe9367

Hi Jakub, Akihiro and Brian,  I see.  I'm sorry I made you confuse.  Yes, we don't need to target RC-2 but stein's window if we can backport these patches into rocky/queens."}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-08-10 12:17:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

Stein development is now open as RC1 has been shipped. My point is that good test coverage is along with the fix to avoid the regression again.
If the functional test coverage is not simple, I am okay to merge this and backport it (because the broken feature is more confusing). I hope functional test coverage is coming and can be backport soon.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-08-10 12:20:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

commit_message:
Fix no ACCEPT event can get for security group logging

Currently, we cannot get ACCEPT packet log because there are some
changed related to ovs firewall code since ovs firewall logging has
been merged.

Regarding to performance perspective, we only log first accepted packet.
So we only need to forward first accepted packet of each connection
session to table 91 and table 92.

So this patch fixes these issues.

Closes-Bug: #1782576
Change-Id: Ib6ced838a7ec6d5c459a8475318556001c31bdf0

TEMPEST_AUTH_VERSION should be 'v3' or 'v2' not 'v2.0'.

Change-Id: I5f7e3bcf733edbbee06016bcad4845dda552815e
"}]
commit_message:
Fix TEMPEST_AUTH_VERSION comparision condition for identity v2

TEMPEST_AUTH_VERSION should be 'v3' or 'v2' not 'v2.0'.
To disable the identity v2 admin tests TEMPEST_AUTH_VERSION is
being compared with 'v2.0' which is incorrect.

Change-Id: I5f7e3bcf733edbbee06016bcad4845dda552815e

commit_message:
Fill aggregate schema for microversion 2.41

The ‘uuid’ attribute of an aggregate is returned from calls
to the /os-aggregates endpoint from microversion 2.41, so
this is to add 'uuid' in schema of aggregate.

https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/reference/api-microversion-history.html#id37

Change-Id: I90e53056ceae5ad6b6ea2995f3f8c6eceea4739a
partially-implements: blueprint full-schema-for-all-microversions

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-13 12:47:30.000000000', 'message': 'Reserve 3 migrations for DB backports

Reserve 3 migrations in case we need to backport changes to the
stable/rocky branch. Since there have not been as many DB changes as the
past, only reserving 3 instead of our conventional 5.

Change-Id: I065b9445547f6e8e1d3732ffd76ca7ddcbc9cfc6
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Reserve 3 migrations for DB backports

Reserve 3 migrations in case we need to backport changes to the
stable/rocky branch. Since there have not been as many DB changes as the
past, only reserving 3 instead of our conventional 5.

Change-Id: I065b9445547f6e8e1d3732ffd76ca7ddcbc9cfc6
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add py36 testenv

Python 3.6 is installed by default in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
Therefore, according to Transition Plan [1],
it'll be handy to have py36 testenv.

For more details, please check Python2 Deprecation Timeline [2]
and Python3-first Goal - Completion Criteria [3].

[1] https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Python/Python36Transition
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20180529-python2-deprecation-timeline.html
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/575933/8/goals/stein/python3-first.rst@42

Change-Id: I2cfd19f5deece8cda8e7ea4b8ee1b747dc5534ef

commit_message:
update constraint for etcd3gw to get python3 fix

The tooz functional tests in stable/rocky and master that use etcd3 are
failing under python3 because of an encoding problem.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-August/133191.html
https://github.com/dims/etcd3-gateway/commit/224f40972b42c4ff16234c0e78ea765e3fe1af95

Change-Id: I8247a51c26dea4e8b2834b9655ffbb37b36a6af4
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Stop logging overlapping tracebacks
messages:
[{'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-02-21 23:34:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-03-06 01:42:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I like not having two different Pokemon exception handlers stacked one atop the other. However, I'm a little nervous that now we've got code in __call__ that could raise exceptions that we won't catch any more.

TBH, I don't see why __call__, update_request, and handle_request are different methods. We don't override them (nothing inherits from swift.proxy.server.Application) and the latter two only have one call site each, and it's in __call__. Would it make sense to combine them?"}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-07-27 15:04:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-08-13 21:16:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-21 23:34:54.000000000', 'message': "Stop logging overlapping tracebacks

Previously, if an error occurred in ResumingGetter._get_response_parts_iter
we'd both log a traceback *and* reraise the exception... which would most
likely not get caught until the proxy-server's handle_request function
which would log the traceback *again*. That's just stupid.

While we're at it, clean up some dead code because:
 - neither cache_from_env nor update_request should be raising
   exceptions
 - all the major error handling is in handle_request *already*

Partial-Bug: #1736840
Change-Id: I667d3ffa68ca2326a35d7604c0a61570b75d5c6c
"}, {'created': '2018-07-27 15:04:52.000000000', 'message': "Stop logging overlapping tracebacks

Previously, if an error occurred in ResumingGetter._get_response_parts_iter
we'd both log a traceback *and* reraise the exception... which would most
likely not get caught until the proxy-server's handle_request function
which would log the traceback *again*. That's just stupid.

While we're at it, get rid of the blanket exception-catching in handle_request;
we've already got nearly all of it in __call__, let's put it all there.

Partial-Bug: #1736840
Change-Id: I667d3ffa68ca2326a35d7604c0a61570b75d5c6c
"}, {'created': '2018-08-13 21:16:18.000000000', 'message': "Stop logging overlapping tracebacks

Previously, if an error occurred in ResumingGetter._get_response_parts_iter
we'd both log a traceback *and* reraise the exception... which would most
likely not get caught until the proxy-server's handle_request function
which would log the traceback *again*. That's just stupid.

While we're at it, get rid of the blanket exception-catching in handle_request;
we've already got nearly all of it in __call__, let's put it all there.

Partial-Bug: #1736840
Change-Id: I667d3ffa68ca2326a35d7604c0a61570b75d5c6c
"}]
commit_message:
Stop logging overlapping tracebacks

Previously, if an error occurred in ResumingGetter._get_response_parts_iter
we'd both log a traceback *and* reraise the exception... which would most
likely not get caught until the proxy-server's handle_request function
which would log the traceback *again*. That's just stupid.

While we're at it, get rid of the blanket exception-catching in handle_request;
we've already got nearly all of it in __call__, let's put it all there.

Partial-Bug: #1736840
Change-Id: I667d3ffa68ca2326a35d7604c0a61570b75d5c6c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-30 13:36:17.000000000', 'message': 'VMAX Driver - Incorrect SSL cert verification

SSL certificates are not being applied to the REST session as desired.
If a user sets SSL verification to True but does not specify a path
to the SSL cert, SSL is disabled instead of looking in the system
certificate bundle.

Closes-Bug #1772924

Change-Id: I20cb64c11e43c22558939e27708ec678c5723ca2
(cherry picked from commit 512fd07124ea7210a6653e519e964a898a31d406)
'}]
commit_message:
VMAX Driver - Incorrect SSL cert verification

SSL certificates are not being applied to the REST session as desired.
If a user sets SSL verification to True but does not specify a path
to the SSL cert, SSL is disabled instead of looking in the system
certificate bundle.

Closes-Bug #1772924

Change-Id: I20cb64c11e43c22558939e27708ec678c5723ca2
(cherry picked from commit 512fd07124ea7210a6653e519e964a898a31d406)

commit_message:
Set newton-eol branch for tht downloading.

After stable/newton EOL a newton-eol branch
was created to enable the FFU job upstream.
As stable/newton branch is not available anymore
the job fails when trying to fetch newton tht.
This patch changes the former stable/newton
branch for the new one.

Tested in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/563616/9

Change-Id: I8d675b985c452b7fc897c97bc11f73c1a459324b
Closes-Bug: #1786738

commit_message:
Include microversion in OS_VOLUME_API_VERSION

Include Cinder's API microversion in OS_VOLUME_API_VERSION. This ensures
CLI tools have access to the latest Cinder features.

Closes-Bug: #1780287
Change-Id: I7528ae96577f8178ffaf3816f592980e95fb9dd8

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-13 16:25:05.000000000', 'message': "MNAIO: Use single vars file for Ubuntu trusty/xenial/bionic

Given there is almost no difference between the releases, we can
use the same vars file and simple conditionals. The package
'software-properties-common' is available for Trusty & Xenial so
we just use that and remove the unnecessary extra package.

We also now add the correct UCA repositories for Trusty and Bionic
so that we get the latest version of libvirt.

Finally, we simplify the conditional for the iptables binary to
make it far easier to read.

Change-Id: Id4b3711a4d7a0ccc13db956d41017ac01c97825f
"}]
commit_message:
MNAIO: Use single vars file for Ubuntu trusty/xenial/bionic

Given there is almost no difference between the releases, we can
use the same vars file and simple conditionals. The package
'software-properties-common' is available for Trusty & Xenial so
we just use that and remove the unnecessary extra package.

We also now add the correct UCA repositories for Trusty and Bionic
so that we get the latest version of libvirt.

Finally, we simplify the conditional for the iptables binary to
make it far easier to read.

Change-Id: Id4b3711a4d7a0ccc13db956d41017ac01c97825f

Fix CI

We enabled some basic jobs for oslo.limit recently. This patch
fixed the related CI error.

commit_message:
Remove Jeremy Stanley as an official

My term on the TC is coming to an end, and since I plan to run for
reelection I cannot serve as an official at the same time. If the
election officials need their ranks bolstered in the future when I'm
qualified again, I'm happy to add myself back.

Change-Id: I60e164c56fe4780e695298016be25318af46d902

[{'created': '2018-08-09 16:44:22.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Fixes a bug with issubclass() being called on an instance"

This reverts commit e3d772050f3f4de6369b3dd1ba1269e2903666f7.

"formatters" argument in get_dict_properties() and get_item_properties()
expects a class of FormattableColumn instead of its instance.

with isinstance() unexpectedly. As a result, osc-lib 1.11.0 breaks
existing OSC plugin (at least neutronclient OSC plugin).

Story: 2003133
Task: 23255

Change-Id: Ie10063197f02679e987e87cb4852f5230a02f76d
(cherry picked from commit 46e2fb0a58fc06cfce1bb535f432405767d6b78b)

commit_message:
Revert "Fixes a bug with issubclass() being called on an instance"

This reverts commit e3d772050f3f4de6369b3dd1ba1269e2903666f7.

"formatters" argument in get_dict_properties() and get_item_properties()
expects a class of FormattableColumn instead of its instance.

commit e3d772050f3f4de6369b3dd1ba1269e2903666f7 replaced issubclass()
with isinstance() unexpectedly. As a result, osc-lib 1.11.0 breaks
existing OSC plugin (at least neutronclient OSC plugin).

Story: 2003133
Task: 23255

Change-Id: Ie10063197f02679e987e87cb4852f5230a02f76d
(cherry picked from commit 46e2fb0a58fc06cfce1bb535f432405767d6b78b)

There are two other issues that I personally ran into when going through this guide that I would potentially like to see reflected in the documentation:

1. Some proxy servers' seem to have limitations with their https_proxy, which comes up as an error along the lines of "oversized record received". I realize this really has more to do with specific proxy setups, but I think a mention of this problem somewhere could be useful.

2. Unrelated to the proxy information, but if the hostname of the machine has uppercase letters then this setup appears to fail. I personally ran into this because the default hostname when installing ubuntu through VirtualBox is <username>-VirtualBox, which I imagine is not a rare circumstance. The main issue is that the error that comes up from this is huge and mostly consists of a bunch of connection retries.'}, {'account_id': 28618, 'date': '2018-07-17 15:52:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 28618, 'date': '2018-07-17 15:54:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This is a good point, but it is out of the scope of the proxy troubleshooting guide. After discussing with Tin Lam, the hostname issue will not be mentioned in this change.

commit_message:
Docs: update proxy troubleshooting guide

Currently, the proxy troubleshooting guide does not include the IP
address of the Kubernetes API in the defined environment or Ansible
playbook variables. This causes deployments to fail when requests are
routed through proxy servers. This change adds a proxy configuration
section to the beginning of the installation guide and includes the
process of adding the Kubernetes API IP address to the environment and
Ansible playbook variables. It also removes the unecessary sections from
the troubleshooting guide and upgrades the note about resolv.conf being
overwritten to a warning.

Change-Id: I1ff753517b387027f0cc052b18e8822b638cfb4d

Change-Id: I9cd0aaadb66a2ff0f3dc947a7df3dcb9fadd4453

commit_message:
Dell EMC SC: Enabled multiattach in Storage Center Driver

Explicitely set multiattach = True in the data returned from
the get_volume_stats call in the Dell EMC Storage Center driver.

Change-Id: I9cd0aaadb66a2ff0f3dc947a7df3dcb9fadd4453
(cherry picked from commit 2e82f0de90d077f7d87353b59c14f69bff3dbaa5)

commit_message:
Update saio sample config files

Added healthcheck middleware to account, container, object servers
Added the s3api, keymaster, encryption config to the proxy config
file to make it easy to enable it.

Change-Id: I96f120c5bc416e9aba388cbfa6c30b648d6ade2f

Extend volume if during create_volume_from_snapshot() the new volume
is larger than the snapshot it was created from. Added new test case.

Bump driver version to 2.0.11 and updated changelog entry.

The volume has not been created with OVO and a seperate patch will be

Change-Id: Iaeb2596ecd75b86a7a0d3da7fad0bf91b2a02fa0

commit_message:
HPE LeftHand: extend volume if larger than snapshot

Extend volume if during create_volume_from_snapshot() the new volume
is larger than the snapshot it was created from. Added new test case.

Bump driver version to 2.0.11 and updated changelog entry.

Closes-Bug: #1560654

The volume has not been created with OVO and a seperate patch will be
created to switch the dictionary to OVO implementation regarding
volume / snapshot to follow up the OVO comments.

Co-Authored-By: Xinli Guan <xinli@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: Iaeb2596ecd75b86a7a0d3da7fad0bf91b2a02fa0
Signed-off-by: Danny Al-Gaaf <danny.al-gaaf@bisect.de>
(cherry picked from commit f463c395d8fbfb6fb2aac78e948f4e5218561398)

I would like to know what other cores think about it"}, {'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2018-07-25 15:03:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

do any of the CIs use lower-constraints.txt? To my knowledge this is currently only used in zuul's openstack-tox-lower-constraints check.

The problem here is that the current lower-constraints.txt is wrong. That should be abundantly clear from what I've already explained. The effect is that the openstack-tox-lower-constraints check is not testing with the versions that it should be testing, which could be hiding issues.

The lower-constraints check job is new. It should be catching this, but it's far from perfect yet. That is not a reason to wait on this change, though.

This should be fixed in neutron-lib and elsewhere as well. The fact that it has not yet is also not a reason to wait on this change. Consistency is only valuable when you're consistently right, not when you're consistently wrong."}, {'account_id': 10608, 'date': '2018-07-25 15:06:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

[{'created': '2018-07-20 14:01:57.000000000', 'message': "lower the pycodestyle restraint

Neutron's current lower constraint for flake8 is listed as 2.6.2,
which requires pycodestyle >=2.0,<2.1. Yet neutron's current lower
constraint for pycodestyle is 2.4.0, which is well outside that
range. This reduces the lower constraint for pycodestyle to bring
these two library contraints back in synch.

[1] https://gitlab.com/pycqa/flake8/blob/2.6.2/setup.py#L53

Change-Id: I72b495293a5d6bab135568c5b0d52f45184461a5
"}, {'created': '2018-07-20 14:09:39.000000000', 'message': "lower the pycodestyle constraint

Neutron's current lower constraint for flake8 is listed as 2.6.2,
which requires pycodestyle >=2.0,<2.1. Yet neutron's current lower
constraint for pycodestyle is 2.4.0, which is well outside that
range. This reduces the lower constraint for pycodestyle to bring
these two library contraints back in synch.

[1] https://gitlab.com/pycqa/flake8/blob/2.6.2/setup.py#L53

Change-Id: I72b495293a5d6bab135568c5b0d52f45184461a5
"}]
commit_message:
lower the pycodestyle constraint

Neutron's current lower constraint for flake8 is listed as 2.6.2,
which requires pycodestyle >=2.0,<2.1. Yet neutron's current lower
constraint for pycodestyle is 2.4.0, which is well outside that
range. This reduces the lower constraint for pycodestyle to bring
these two library contraints back in synch.

[1] https://gitlab.com/pycqa/flake8/blob/2.6.2/setup.py#L53

Change-Id: I72b495293a5d6bab135568c5b0d52f45184461a5

commit_message:
[n-odl] Make the Y axis display correctly

Currently it is left to auto detection and doesn't show correctly when
the data doesn't hit the limits.

This patch makes sure it is always displayed as a percentage.

Change-Id: I5663b9e5011c5b8a85529cc9edbb7dd9dced3672

commit_message:
Stop holding on to sys.exc_info tuples quite so much

This used to be necessary on older eventlet, or you'd get TypeErrors
when you went to reraise. Following eventlet 0.13.0, however, it's just
extra code.

For the original eventlet issue, see
https://web.archive.org/web/20140823005223/https://bitbucket.org/eventlet/eventlet/issue/149/yield-in-except-clause-with-wilcard-raise

Change-Id: I19ad0968a82827bdd4ef75fde9ed51f193627d6e
Related-Bug: 1181146

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-13 17:52:57.000000000', 'message': 'Update keystone v3 admin URL in UT

We no longer use port 35357 for keystone v3 API admin operation
and it is recommended to use port 5000.
This commit updates keystone catalog for keystone v3 API.
It also replace keystone v2 URL with v3 one.
Note that keystone v2 data is kept as-is.

Change-Id: Ia152d602b80ae418e0020b3ba30a11016a83da6a
'}]
commit_message:
Update keystone v3 admin URL in UT

We no longer use port 35357 for keystone v3 API admin operation
and it is recommended to use port 5000.
This commit updates keystone catalog for keystone v3 API.
It also replace keystone v2 URL with v3 one.
Note that keystone v2 data is kept as-is.

Change-Id: Ia152d602b80ae418e0020b3ba30a11016a83da6a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-03 15:06:44.000000000', 'message': 'Missing user and group member of project in the project detail view for admin

The user and group members of a project are not displayed directly in the project details view for an admin user.

It could be interesting for administrator to display (by example as tabs) the list of users with their roles on the project and the list of group with their roles on the project directly in the details view.

Moreover it could be interesting to indicate users which have roles on a project through a group (because they are member of group which has role on the project).

Change-Id: I207d0671e41c478c258226fd21f83b6e9fd38ea4
Closes-Bug: #1785263

This is done to be able to add other tabs to the project

commit_message:
Change project details view in a tab view.

Change the existing project details view into a tabbed view with
currently just one tab (overview tab) which presents general
informations of the project.

This is done to be able to add other tabs to the project
details view.

Change-Id: I207d0671e41c478c258226fd21f83b6e9fd38ea4
Partial-Bug: #1785263

[{'created': '2018-08-10 15:29:55.000000000', 'message': 'Correct Cinder NetApp backend name parameter mapping

Change to pass CinderNetappBackendName to the correct
parameter in the Cinder puppet module:

  cinder::backend::netapp::volume_backend_name

This allows backend name overrides to be reflected in
the deployed overcloud.

Change-Id: I851f0a5bdcd82d6bcca78da1f530a1e0b77a757c
Closes-Bug: 1779500
(cherry picked from commit 7d85acf2a81365ce0a8e06f88ecb18bae8ea785f)
'}]
commit_message:
Correct Cinder NetApp backend name parameter mapping

Change to pass CinderNetappBackendName to the correct
parameter in the Cinder puppet module:

  cinder::backend::netapp::volume_backend_name

This allows backend name overrides to be reflected in
the deployed overcloud.

Change-Id: I851f0a5bdcd82d6bcca78da1f530a1e0b77a757c
Closes-Bug: 1779500
(cherry picked from commit 7d85acf2a81365ce0a8e06f88ecb18bae8ea785f)

commit_message:
Add tags to OpenShift external tasks to allow upgrading it separately

When running `openstack overcloud external-upgrade run`, all services
using external installers are upgraded. Tags are added to OpenShift
external deploy/upgrade tasks, to allow upgrading OpenShift by itself
via `openstack overcloud external-upgrade run --tags openshift`.

Change-Id: I7335849155080b7f6c32df85cd48d0d11d86d9e0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-10 16:46:30.000000000', 'message': "Don't use the undercloud containers during mixed upgrade.

When doing mixed upgrade we don't want to use the container definition
file generated during undercloud deployment.

The problem is that at that time (undercloud deployment) the build_id
and docker_registry_namespace_used are (rightly) pointing to master.
But then during mixed upgrade overcloud deployment we need the N-1
version docker's images.

Change-Id: Ice13dceba7417e1ef827f4ab44fd08d2d13922fd
Closes-Bug: #1786488
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use the undercloud containers during mixed upgrade.

When doing mixed upgrade we don't want to use the container definition
file generated during undercloud deployment.

The problem is that at that time (undercloud deployment) the build_id
and docker_registry_namespace_used are (rightly) pointing to master.
But then during mixed upgrade overcloud deployment we need the N-1
version docker's images.

Change-Id: Ice13dceba7417e1ef827f4ab44fd08d2d13922fd
Closes-Bug: #1786488

subject: Implements possibility to use physical networks in containers.
messages: [{'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2018-08-13 10:30:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-08-13 10:38:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 26285, 'date': '2018-08-13 11:18:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-08-13 17:32:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2018-08-13 18:47:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-13 10:30:17.000000000', 'message': 'Implements possibility to use physical networks in containers.

This is usefull, if SR-IOV is used, and it's possible to
supply every container with it's own interface.
Especially usefull, if infinband is used (for example, for ceph),
as it can not be added into bridge.

openstack-user-config should be modified in this way for every service
within affected network:

- network:
    container_bridge: "ib5"
    container_type: "phys"
    container_interface: "ib5"
    ip_from_q: "storage"
    type: "raw"
    group_binds:
      - cinder_volume

Change-Id: I299aa3fb26f5278d2c86bb18c5df5abddcf0ff65
(cherry picked from commit 27697e9126cd32abf3e9dbb1eeac860805967edf)
'}]
commit_message:
Implements possibility to use physical networks in containers.

This is usefull, if SR-IOV is used, and it's possible to
supply every container with it's own interface.
Especially usefull, if infinband is used (for example, for ceph),
as it can not be added into bridge.

openstack-user-config should be modified in this way for every service
within affected network:

- network:
    container_bridge: "ib5"
    container_type: "phys"
    container_interface: "ib5"
    ip_from_q: "storage"
    type: "raw"
    group_binds:
      - cinder_volume

Change-Id: I299aa3fb26f5278d2c86bb18c5df5abddcf0ff65
(cherry picked from commit 27697e9126cd32abf3e9dbb1eeac860805967edf)

commit_message:
Added drivers for coordination.

Into gnocchi_pip_packages were added kazoo and redis packages.
These services are adviced by Tooz as coordinators backends.

Coordination is required to get metrics processing distribution among
service containers/instances.

Change-Id: Iaa608bf6690f35b1aa4afd08b1d60b0752230c4e
(cherry picked from commit 029216cc465d6103444a94399afab49918f03ee7)

commit_message:
Added drivers for coordination.

Into gnocchi_pip_packages were added kazoo and redis packages.
These services are adviced by Tooz as coordinators backends.

Coordination is required to get metrics processing distribution among
service containers/instances.

Change-Id: Iaa608bf6690f35b1aa4afd08b1d60b0752230c4e
(cherry picked from commit 029216cc465d6103444a94399afab49918f03ee7)

commit_message:
undercloud: enable KernelIpNonLocalBind

We need KernelIpNonLocalBind on the undercloud to bind non local ips
among other ip forward options. This sysctl parameter was managed by
instack-undercloud but never ported to the containerized undercloud.
We need the same sysctl parameters for parity with non containerized
undercloud.

Change-Id: Idd3d432b8f7eb573d94cd56be8e05614510ebddf
Related-Bug: #1774898
(cherry picked from 32ea5028fd2d4969ef1f2b089fb4ca6ef0dee8b1)
Conflicts:
    environments/undercloud.yaml

commit_message:
Allow to specify redirections on single IdP scenarios

In scenarios where the cloud operators have only a single Identity Provider,
we can have a default redirection to remove unnecessary user clicks and
improve user experience.

Closes-bug: #1784368

Change-Id: I251703dcaeac43174fbcba7e0658c6f92098b2e0

Thanks! The release notes aren't generated. Now I am wondering if they are only generated if there was a change to the renos.

Duplicate jobs for docs; I am guessing that will be addressed in a future patch to the other config repo.

Would be good to have a story to track all this; I thought the openstack goals always had a story to track them?"}]

commit_message:
Update metering driver to load interface driver

Currently the metering iptables driver is using the old method
to load the interface driver. This patch allows it to load
interface driver via stevedore aliases.

Change-Id: I9e3027c1ec695ec3a09db0c53a0388e406e4ced6
Related-Bug: #1504536

commit_message:
Remove deprecated option node_status_keep_time

[DEFAULT]node_status_keep_time is deprecated long ago [1], this
patch removes it so that inspector will not automatically remove
node status in regards to configuration option.

This also make sense when we use other store backends in the
future.

Change-Id: I8261ce115fdb03ffcfe3a1cc4ca7c8ec747be832
Related-Bug: #1695858

commit_message:
__repr__ crashes when empty dict passed

The Capabilities class __repr__ method crashes when
along with any manager object, the info is passed as
empty dict.
This patch handles the issue.

Change-Id: Ife5cfc82137d107b27b011aa83c3a9c89e78d701
Closes-Bug: #1785091

commit_message:
Update name for virtualbmc CI job

The names on the virtualbmc CI job is no longer correct
as ironic has removed classic drivers. As such the name
should represent what is tested, which is an ipmi managed
iscsi deployment.

Change-Id: Ibca489f75af28574a4a0de990c752b04d991bc45

Update docs for /var/lib/mistral/<plan name>

under /var/lib/mistral.

[{'created': '2018-08-10 16:28:52.000000000', 'message': 'Added drivers for coordination.

Into ceilometer_pip_packages were added kazoo and redis packages.
These services are adviced by Tooz as coordinators backends.

Coordination is required to get metrics processing distribution among
service containers/instances.

'}]
commit_message:
Added drivers for coordination.

Into ceilometer_pip_packages were added kazoo and redis packages.
These services are adviced by Tooz as coordinators backends.

Coordination is required to get metrics processing distribution among
service containers/instances.

Change-Id: I9ac2b7ae2eb4c1d1723a1cb2df592267145a114a

commit_message:
Switch to pep8 jobs for mogan-specs

After moving to use zuulv3, the tox-py* jobs will ignore doc changes, so
we'd better to drop the py27, py35 jobs targets, and instead, we need to
run doc8 against the spec directory from the pep8 target.

Depends-On: I3bebbd6107e5bb57eae3af0fa8871760423cb343
Change-Id: I07854db1cf0147f3d86bea0af2559991cbf3d242

subject: add a keep-proxy element
messages:
[{'account_id': 22169, 'date': '2016-07-25 07:16:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-07-25 16:43:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Verified+1

Build succeeded (check pipeline).

- gate-project-config-layout http://logs.openstack.org/19/346619/1/check/gate-project-config-layout/e2cb90e/ : SUCCESS in 9m 06s
- gate-project-config-linters http://logs.openstack.org/19/346619/1/check/gate-project-config-linters/876eef6/ : SUCCESS in 2m 24s
- gate-project-config-dib http://logs.openstack.org/19/346619/1/check/gate-project-config-dib/877b40f/ : SUCCESS in 1m 35s'}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2016-07-25 18:02:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I worry about this regressing quickly. We don't have to use http proxies for apt/pip in our env so it will quickly break when we next add a sudo pip/apt to our image build scripts. One alternative would be to have sudo pass through http_proxy in our sudo configuration then all invocations of sudo should just work. This should avoid regressions in the future as we add sudo pip/apt calls.

Another option that should avoid regressions is configuring apt and pip directly to use a proxy but I think configuring sudo to pass through http_proxy globally is probably the simplest option."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2016-07-25 18:13:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Clarks suggestion makes sense. I'll add that it's also more tightly focused on just the envvar you need, and so avoids unnecessarily polluting the environment for that command in other, unexpected ways.

Either way passing http_proxy through sudo is a risky proposition in many cases where sudo may be restricted to only certain commands (since it could allow the user to subvert an allowed command that downloads and runs something to escalate to broader root privileges), but in the case of our single-use job workers this is less of a concern."}, {'account_id': 22169, 'date': '2016-07-26 00:42:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I worry about this regressing quickly. We don't have to use http
 > proxies for apt/pip in our env so it will quickly break when we
 > next add a sudo pip/apt to our image build scripts. One alternative
 > would be to have sudo pass through http_proxy in our sudo
 > configuration then all invocations of sudo should just work. This
 > should avoid regressions in the future as we add sudo pip/apt
 > calls.
 > 
 > Another option that should avoid regressions is configuring apt and
 > pip directly to use a proxy but I think configuring sudo to pass
 > through http_proxy globally is probably the simplest option.

 > I worry about this regressing quickly. We don't have to use http
 > proxies for apt/pip in our env so it will quickly break when we
 > next add a sudo pip/apt to our image build scripts. One alternative
 > would be to have sudo pass through http_proxy in our sudo
 > configuration then all invocations of sudo should just work. This
 > should avoid regressions in the future as we add sudo pip/apt
 > calls.
 > 
 > Another option that should avoid regressions is configuring apt and
 > pip directly to use a proxy but I think configuring sudo to pass
 > through http_proxy globally is probably the simplest option.

Thanks for your suggestion. It's very instructive for me,I will focus on what envvar I need."}, {'account_id': 22169, 'date': '2016-07-26 00:44:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Clarks suggestion makes sense. I'll add that it's also more tightly
 > focused on just the envvar you need, and so avoids unnecessarily
 > polluting the environment for that command in other, unexpected
 > ways.
 > 
 > Either way passing http_proxy through sudo is a risky proposition
 > in many cases where sudo may be restricted to only certain commands
 > (since it could allow the user to subvert an allowed command that
 > downloads and runs something to escalate to broader root
 > privileges), but in the case of our single-use job workers this is
 > less of a concern.

Thanks both of you,I will try to improve my code"}, {'account_id': 22169, 'date': '2016-07-26 07:03:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-07-26 07:31:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

Build failed (check pipeline).  For information on how to proceed, see http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html#automated-testing

- gate-project-config-layout http://logs.openstack.org/19/346619/2/check/gate-project-config-layout/d37ab9b/ : SUCCESS in 13m 25s
- gate-project-config-dib http://logs.openstack.org/19/346619/2/check/gate-project-config-dib/cbaca48/ : FAILURE in 2m 05s'}, {'account_id': 22169, 'date': '2016-07-26 11:10:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-07-26 11:45:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified-1

variables if they have the same name,so add -E option won't effect -H
environment variable and will make a proxy available at the same time.

commit_message:
add a keep-proxy element

Thinking about that those codes may be used for serverl element but should be
called only once.Make those codes an independent element is a way to achive
this.

Change-Id: I0307e5d31f21c1ac0e33f193fc9bf723a7230857

for now, and if we need them again, we can add them back.

I haven't tried following the directions yet, but it might be worth doing just for repeatability. :)"}, {'account_id': 19137, 'date': '2018-08-13 07:56:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 19137, 'date': '2018-08-13 08:16:39.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Pushed in new commit with changes as per comment https://review.openstack.org/#/c/591292/, consider this as duplicate'}, {'account_id': 10311, 'date': '2018-08-13 17:47:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

You don't have to abandon a commit if you just need to make a tweak.  You can use git review to update a previous change and resubmit it - 1.) in your local copy, make the change, 2) use 'git status' to see your changes and 'git log' to verify your previous commit is the latest change in the history, 3) use 'git add' to mark your new changes to be included, 4) use 'git commit --amend' to add the new changes to your previous change (this will show your previous commit message which you can adjust if needed), then 5) use 'git review <target branch>' to push the updated commit to gerrit as a new patch."}]

commit_message:
Refactor PKCS#11 to allow configurable mechanisms

Allow for setting the PKCS#11 encryption and hmac algorithms
in the config file.

This patch also implements CKM_AES_CBC encryption and
decryption.

Change-Id: I847b4b17df51bc4846c37a1e19e6adec76f46b38
Co-Authored-By: Ade Lee <alee@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Improved getQosPolicy error messages

Added specific policy id to error message and other minor improvements
to the functions including updating the related tests.

subject: Configure access_key and secret_key as secret
messages:
[{'account_id': 26581, 'date': '2018-08-13 08:18:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-08-13 08:18:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-08-13 12:21:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2018-08-13 15:46:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Deprecate auth_uri option

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated [1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

Does not change auth_uri for providers because [2] will change
that to auth_url.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/588504/

Change-Id: I134f6318f3d409f9aa3368e93e9ef55a82ab6788

Adds release-openstack-server jobs to ansible-role-tripleo-* repos.

This change also reduces gerritbot config for tripleo repos by use of
a regex.

messages: [{'account_id': 8716, 'date': '2018-08-13 16:53:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-09 17:09:18.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I427a5c69ae940dccbe4c41015ee2a00645ad9ce7
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I427a5c69ae940dccbe4c41015ee2a00645ad9ce7

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I628e9955278029c436bcdb7a972c10bdb0f0cd57

commit_message:
[placement] api-ref: Add missing aggregates example

About "PUT /resource_providers/{uuid}/aggregates"
in the Placement API reference,
the example of the response body in microversion 1.1 - 1.18 is missing.
So add it.

Change-Id: Ic3dc665124ae7927cfa20cf70a08c39b856b8961
Closes-Bug: #1786759

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-09 21:32:17.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I6615c773e88741d85571125528715dbcaef68686
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I6615c773e88741d85571125528715dbcaef68686

commit_message:
Moving UCS specs to backlog

Checked-in with Sam Betts and he indicated that these
items are not current priorites. As such, since they are
not being worked on, moving to backlog.

They can be moved back at any time, this move is to try
and help clarify what is in-progress or partially implemented
when looking at not-implemented.

Change-Id: Ice9e05806dea9c6409b8f52d20d7826a7ffb69bc

commit_message:
Add node secureboot fields to objects layer

Adds 'secureboot_key' and 'secureboot_certificate' to the node object,
and bumps the RPC version.

commit_message:
Add secureboot fields to node

This adds 'secureboot_key' and 'secureboot_certificate' fields to the
node schema, so nodes can fetch them at boot time.

Change-Id: I4d0f8da06571aee4e709016bac9f7a24ff14b900

commit_message:
Remove testr

We're not using testr or stestr anywhere in this project,
this environment is unused.
Therefore, we should remove testr completely.

Change-Id: I50cf179487f3bea69e57d3a0ab2be4eb6b65423d

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I55106795e8a7813dba07bc250cd4fb098c9ea174
Story: #2003250

subject: Bump ansible for linters
messages:
[{'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-08-10 04:15:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-08-10 04:46:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

how do we remember to change this when we go to a new ansible?'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-08-10 04:51:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> how do we remember to change this when we go to a new ansible?

write a dependency solver and contribute it to pip? :)  It's probably only new syntax that tickles this (and possibly if there's a bug, but that seems unlikely) so not sure how much effort it is worth"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-08-10 05:11:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The other option here is just to uncap it, and let it pull in whatever.  That would be pulling in 2.6 ATM.  It just seemed a bit odd to lint with the version that isn't running in the gate"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-08-10 05:19:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm fine with capping it. I just fear we update zuul to 2.6 at one point and still test 2.5 here. So, how to keep those in sync?"}, {'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2018-08-13 16:23:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-10 04:15:24.000000000', 'message': 'Bump ansible for linters

I noticed this when I tried to use Ansible 2.5 "loop:" constructs.

Unfortunately, we can't just rely on bringing in zuul to pull the
right version of ansible.  ansible-lint being uncapped just takes it
over, and we end up with the latest version.  Pin it to the current
zuul requirements and add a note (maybe one day
https://github.com/pypa/pip/issues/988 will get a fix ...)

Change-Id: Iaf8f0f5cdc46df41fec7c436c1179c80bb5c368e
'}]
commit_message:
Bump ansible for linters

I noticed this when I tried to use Ansible 2.5 "loop:" constructs.

Unfortunately, we can't just rely on bringing in zuul to pull the
right version of ansible.  ansible-lint being uncapped just takes it
over, and we end up with the latest version.  Pin it to the current
zuul requirements and add a note (maybe one day
https://github.com/pypa/pip/issues/988 will get a fix ...)

Change-Id: Iaf8f0f5cdc46df41fec7c436c1179c80bb5c368e

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-10 04:30:24.000000000', 'message': "linters: Take a guess at the roles path

It's probably reasonable to assume that for interactive use, the
required roles for linting in zuul-jobs and openstack-zuul-jobs are in
sibling directories of project-config.  Set this as the default
environment value.

Change-Id: I388fdae998ac3cb87c30616ed761c888e1e429f0
"}]
commit_message:
linters: Take a guess at the roles path

It's probably reasonable to assume that for interactive use, the
required roles for linting in zuul-jobs and openstack-zuul-jobs are in
sibling directories of project-config.  Set this as the default
environment value.

Change-Id: I388fdae998ac3cb87c30616ed761c888e1e429f0

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I4954803ccc9fc45dea82f84bf7c34cfca13e427c
Story: #2003250

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I5c4d37afdc438cc978bff37e4d0c56c7ad60fb19

commit_message:
OVN: Add exec puppet tag to ovn-controller service file

The depends on patch (in puppet-ovn) now makes use of "exec" to set
mac table size of provider bridges. We need "exec" puppet tag
to run that successfully.

Depends-On: I8f392c7807c4c6a152dfa4b77c7f4350b44324c0
Change-Id: Ie7f000c658cab31dd6f453e02b55ac244d0328e2
Closes-bug: #1779706
(cherry picked from commit ddb211680421a6ea6458c924b599ff3cbdf25b99)

commit_message:
enhance publish-openstack-sphinx-docs description

Link to Doc contributor guide on how to add something to the main index
and also explain that docs.o.o is for official projects only.

Update some doc templates, since the PTI has changed we now have legacy
jobs and new PTI ones.

Change-Id: I933628d3864dd3d706831985efbc12ac413812dc

commit_message:
Translation cleanup

Remove ocata/pike translations of now retired django_openstack_auth, pike
and ocata are not translated anymore.

Use translation-jobs-master-only for magnum-ui/manila-ui together with
the rocky template and add a comment that this can be changed once
queens is retired (queens is part of translation-jobs-master-stable).

Change-Id: I4590f796d7adbddbd1e49ea6770e998167462ce3

subject: Update unit test to reflect latest oslo.config
messages: [{'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-08-13 15:39:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-08-13 15:40:11.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nOops, this was already included in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/586151/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-13 15:39:11.000000000', 'message': 'Update unit test to reflect latest oslo.config

Because we added the default config_source opt in oslo.config, it
is now showing up in the GMR output and needs to be included in the
expected content.  However, for lower constraints testing we also
need to continue to support the older versions without config_source,
so the target_str is built dynamically based on whether the opt
exists.

Change-Id: I20b01285000ce84b69e8bd3cee8078edf03616f8
(cherry picked from commit 98c0d2c1db7bbcb30b5bfe4f347bdb2124de25a5)
'}]
commit_message:
Update unit test to reflect latest oslo.config

Because we added the default config_source opt in oslo.config, it
is now showing up in the GMR output and needs to be included in the
expected content.  However, for lower constraints testing we also
need to continue to support the older versions without config_source,
so the target_str is built dynamically based on whether the opt
exists.

Change-Id: I20b01285000ce84b69e8bd3cee8078edf03616f8
(cherry picked from commit 98c0d2c1db7bbcb30b5bfe4f347bdb2124de25a5)

commit_message:
Switch to using stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1] stestr
is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch it then.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I0b3134d96a75cdc3911d829403226e700e70ee12
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

commit_message:

Because we added the default config_source opt in oslo.config, it
is now showing up in the GMR output and needs to be included in the
expected content.  However, for lower constraints testing we also
need to continue to support the older versions without config_source,
so the target_str is built dynamically based on whether the opt
exists.

commit_message:
W/a kubespray vault install failure

The experimental kubespray installation should explicitly
install pip requirements, see
https://github.com/kubernetes-incubator/kubespray/issues/2764

Change-Id: Id1520a450731169407feb31d61ed8cd499c61684
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Alter default http boot path for BM Ironic

Containerization of UC is a default choice as if Rocky.
IRONIC_HTTP_BOOT_BIND_MOUNT in the tripleoclient points to
'/var/lib/ironic/httpboot', which works only for the containerized
Ironic. We want to keep it working for BM Ironic as well. Hence, alter
the http_boot path for hiera defaults from /httpboot to
/var/lib/ironic/httpboot.

This allows instack running non containerized Ironic to provision
baremetal overclouds for Rocky, as if Ironic was running in containers
(so the same /var/lib/ironic/httpboot path is used for both cases).

Change-Id: I48e6439f294165a90c622ae55185c8ebb9e79238
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Switch to fedora-latest for testing

This bumps testing on fedora to 28, it also allows openstack-infra in
the future to make changes to fedora much easier.

Also, Dogtag now pulls in python3-requests, so no need to remove the
pip installed python2-requests, which is needed by keystone-manage.

Remove barbican-dogtag-devstack-fedora-27 as it is unused.

Change-Id: I7635f039848f8c3ab052f339344bb1cb8ea4aecd
(cherry picked from commit 1705cbdd953ea43b84544d2714c8db2214b667b6)
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/590769
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Release heat tempest plugin 0.2.0

As we previous do 0.1.0 in pypi [1] already, to avoid confusions,
we use 0.2.0 as rocky release version.

[1] https://pypi.org/project/heat-tempest-plugin/

Change-Id: Id4d2eae5a0f4b9ec7706205dbd01aa38f211c819

commit_message:
Fix TEMPEST_AUTH_VERSION comparision condition for identity v2

TEMPEST_AUTH_VERSION should be 'v3' or 'v2' not 'v2.0'.
To disable the identity v2 admin tests TEMPEST_AUTH_VERSION is
being compared with 'v2.0' which is incorrect.

Change-Id: I5f7e3bcf733edbbee06016bcad4845dda552815e

commit_message:
SSL support for haproxy -> novnc proxy connection

With tls-everywhere enabled the connection from haproxy to the nova novnc
proxy was not encrypted. Now we request a certificate and configue haproxy
and the novnc proxy to encrypt this remaining part in a vnc connection to
be encrypted as well.

Change-Id: Ia0c8c452f0121298bef58409bd0bdbe4caa54e42
Closes-Bug: #1785700
Depends-On: Ice51fe175bdc1cb14fa49cf53d1f38e9728bbb60
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/591272
(cherry picked from commit 8d163a21f5c932631736c7e87c168cacdf93ce01)

With tls-everywhere enabled the connection from haproxy to the nova novnc

commit_message:
Add limited retries in create_swift_temp_url_key.sh

Adds a limited number of retries in case the getting the Swift
account info or setting the temp-url key fails for whatever reason.

Change-Id: I080e2f07d060c2d8805346026e8e5740255bb18e
Closes-Bug: 1785130

commit_message:
Remove --container-registry-file parameter from * upgrade clis

Currently the container image registry references are passed with
--container-registry-file in prepare but as -e in converge for
the upgrade/update/ffwd-upgrade/ceph-upgrade clis.

There is no special handling of the file, and it is ultimately
included as any other environment file [1].

This removes the --container-registry-file parameter from
openstack overcloud [upgrade|update|ffwd-upgrade|ceph-upgrade]
prepare.

The related tripleo-common review is for removal of the parameter
from the mistral workflow and action

The related tripleo-docs patch is for updating the operator
instructions to include the container image registry references
using -e as any other environment file.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-common/blob/2c83dc964bc3a00504d580cbad8eb54f45fad8bf/tripleo_common/actions/package_update.py#L60
Related: https://review.openstack.org/570903 tripleo-docs
Partial-Bug: #1785825
Co-Authored-By: Jiri Stransky <jistr@jistr.com>
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/571186
Change-Id: Id2811dbef59d1be2a35cea062eb7116648f52145

commit_message:
Remove container_registry param from package update action

The package_update_plan mistrl workflow is invoked in upgrade|update|
ceph-upgrade|ffwd-upgrade prepare clis. The container registry
parameter is being removed and we will use treat it as a regular
environment file (see depends-on). This removes it from the Mistral
action and keeps it defaulted in the workflow to prevent
chicken-and-egg issues with CI. We'll remove the workflow parameter in
a follow-up patch.

Partial-Bug: #1785825
Co-Authored-By: Jiri Stransky <jistr@jistr.com>
Related: https://review.openstack.org/570893 python-tripleoclient
Change-Id: I4130dd1eea6caec82dcb4a699875f2951693148f

[{'created': '2018-04-23 21:59:56.000000000', 'message': "Accommodate for neutron code that expires obsolete relationships

Neutron is going to introduce a change that will make sqlalchemy to
automatically expire models reached through obsolete / invalid foreign keys.
Because of that, we need to recreate policy models after they are popped up
from the policies' list because old models immediately become expired.

Also, this patch adds a new backref to LoadBalancer model that reverse-links it
to provider model. This is also needed to accommodate for the neutron change
that assumes a relationship is always to have a reverse property linking back
to parent / child model.

Change-Id: If4b28110f460f6ac77ace1bbb02967ea986d4cab
Needed-By: I0d65d19204da8ce30addfa5faff68544534b7853
"}]
commit_message:
Accommodate for neutron code that expires obsolete relationships

Neutron is going to introduce a change that will make sqlalchemy to
automatically expire models reached through obsolete / invalid foreign keys.
Because of that, we need to recreate policy models after they are popped up
from the policies' list because old models immediately become expired.

Also, this patch adds a new backref to LoadBalancer model that reverse-links it
to provider model. This is also needed to accommodate for the neutron change
that assumes a relationship is always to have a reverse property linking back
to parent / child model.

Change-Id: If4b28110f460f6ac77ace1bbb02967ea986d4cab

commit_message:
Add Prometheus node_exporter

This change introduces node_exporter into the monitoring stack. The
role from cloudalchemi is used for the bulk of the deployment.

Change-Id: I1343db378f9dee056a5fb67e0dc9e89e11bc7e28

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I0ec7bc7926e57b243e38b2c696815e648d0b3f61

commit_message:
trivial: Fix some compute api_schema formatting nits

This patch set corrects 2 api_schema formatting nits associated
with following issues:

* 'dd' follows a NOTE in two files which is strange and has
  been removed
* get_server in v2_48 schema should be under the section for
  unchanged schemas for better organization

Change-Id: Id3dc37dc6cc176e38e676d34eba6483d75ecfa54

commit_message:
Updating CloudKitty PTL information

New PTLs who hadn't specified an IRC nick have been required to
specify it in the governance repository. This also updates
informations about CloudKitty's new PTL.

Change-Id: Id37076bfef3f78524f071a329a9923fb94247964

subject: Add magnum image packages
messages:
[{'account_id': 25242, 'date': '2018-06-26 02:33:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25242, 'date': '2018-06-26 02:47:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 25242, 'date': '2018-06-26 03:09:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 22477, 'date': '2018-06-29 02:34:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22477, 'date': '2018-06-29 03:12:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

As Tin pointed out in a different PS, python-magnumclient has been deprecated in favor of openstack client.  Can we use that instead?'}, {'account_id': 25242, 'date': '2018-07-06 07:30:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> As Tin pointed out in a different PS, python-magnumclient has been
 > deprecated in favor of openstack client.  Can we use that instead?

python-magnumclient 2.3.1 for openstack newton does not support osc[0], so we could not use osc for openstack newton test.
There also no deprecated warning in magnum client, so it shoud be OK in openstack newton and pike release.

[0] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/magnum/+spec/openstackclient-support'}, {'account_id': 25242, 'date': '2018-08-13 14:15:13.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

Signed-off-by: Ranler Cao <caoran@fiberhome.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add magnum image packages

This patch add two packages:

* python-magnumclient for magnum helm test
* iproute2 for magnum-conductor readiness check

Change-Id: I45459d0d8f165791d182b7201552dd08165326b9
Signed-off-by: Ranler Cao <caoran@fiberhome.com>

If so, point me to it and I'll abandon this."}, {'account_id': 21486, 'date': '2018-08-02 09:27:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-08-13 05:32:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

So this was changed with Iad66e14fa33609ea6d2a115469e054762051b964 but I'd agree this has no other references ... I have no idea what we were thinking at the time, but I doubt we can change this as it's in external repos"}, {'account_id': 28003, 'date': '2018-08-13 05:56:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2018-08-13 12:36:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Thanks!'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-27 19:51:47.000000000', 'message': 'Correct neutron docs

The neutron guide refers to ENABLE_PROJECT_VLANS and
PROJECT_VLAN_RANGE but these are not present/checked in the code,
which uses ENABLE_TENANT_VLANS and TENANT_VLAN_RANGE. This
corrects the documentation to match.

Change-Id: I204356c861157e9fab357bb4dde55185bf18a707
'}]
commit_message:
Correct neutron docs

The neutron guide refers to ENABLE_PROJECT_VLANS and
PROJECT_VLAN_RANGE but these are not present/checked in the code,
which uses ENABLE_TENANT_VLANS and TENANT_VLAN_RANGE. This
corrects the documentation to match.

commit_message:
Set transport_url in proper keystone config section

The RPC transport_url for keystone was being set in the DEFAULT
section, even though keystone doesn't do anything with it. Instead,
keystone leans on the [oslo_messaging_notification] section from
oslo.messaging to register the transport_url option.

This change sets the transport_url in the proper section instead of
using the DEFAULT section.

Change-Id: I11590d0175da7ea310d5529f2d7c0bf8d7fb25b3
