commit_message:
Fix inconsistency (nit)

Word choice of description for "host-evacuate-live" is slightly
different from that in novaclient ("migrate of" instead of "migrate off").
https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/master/doc/source/cli/nova.rst#nova-host-evacuate-live
They are supposed to be exactly the same, so use "migrate off" to
keep consistent.

Change-Id: Ie54c6ed83b6e9a3116e1832b3fb36dd80781366d

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-08-06 22:46:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

Pending developer documentation that I'd still need to write on what makes a good candidate for one of these, and probably doing some analysis of the upgrade release notes for the core projects to find some candidates for project teams to think about, I think this is a good high level start for the goal."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-08-07 09:00:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1

I support this as a Stein goal, although it could use a bit more detail :)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-08-07 15:44:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1

Assuming we don't need to wait for all the detail, I also think this is a useful thing and we have some good examples in what nova's doing (which makes all the difference when trying to figure stuff out)."}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2018-08-07 18:06:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1

This seems like a good idea, and should be minimal enough for smaller teams to get a basic framework (as long as we have a good base to work from) and some initial checks.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-08-07 20:25:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2018-08-09 12:18:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2018-08-09 13:49:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Is this blueprint will allow more complex tests like, create some vm, do some steps (add floating ip, attach storage, etc) and then test it after the upgrade?'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-08-09 16:56:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Is this blueprint will allow more complex tests like, create some
 > vm, do some steps (add floating ip, attach storage, etc) and then
 > test it after the upgrade?

I don't think that's the point, no. Sometimes there are tasks an operator needs to do before an upgrade can proceed, and some of those are things that we can test for and tell whether they are done. The point is to provide a common way in all projects to run those sorts of checks on a running cloud."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-08-09 16:56:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

This proposal has enough votes to pass and will be approved on 2018-08-11 unless the voting changes.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-08-13 13:48:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Add Stein goal for upgrade checkers

This adds a cycle goal for Stein of having an upgrade check command for
each project that will look for any known issues that could cause
upgrades to fail.

Change-Id: I7968c6736651fa46a11d1d73e1ba2241b0540894
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Upgrade Apache Kafka to ver. 0.10.2.2 in devstack

Keep log message format to ver. 0.9.0 to support old kafka-python
consumers.

Note on the backport: in stable branches we use Kafka 0.10.2.2
rather than the original 1.0.1 since this is the oldest
version to fix CVE-2018-1288[0]. Consequently our CI for
stable branches should use at least this version to ensure we
support a Kafka release without this vulnerability.

[0] https://www.securityfocus.com/bid/104900

Story: 2002746
Task: 22599

Change-Id: I6a092d64906a939d404abb3e43fc017d2eee74ea
(cherry picked from commit 7ee549b422290b4acb96e34b51b85f033cf2b6fa)
(cherry picked from commit 92cbab8de2b649e45f70f409683b63710359d7c1)

subject: Branch ironic-tempest-plugin for Rocky
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 11655, 'name': 'Julia Kreger', 'email': 'juliaashleykreger@gmail.com', 'username': 'jkreger', 'status': 'On the moon! With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-08-13 13:24:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-08-13 13:32:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The only reason the plugins are separate is to make them branchless. If we back off this decision, we should move them back.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-08-13 13:36:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Well, we now published versions and I agree with you Dmitry, except there seems to be the desire to have versioned releases (which makes less sense with the goal of tempest in mind. I just see having the branch as a means to bump the revision number and release because perfection is unobtainable. That being said, I'm pretty much out of all spoons on this subject though because of the back and forth that has occurred. Marking -1."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-08-13 13:40:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Right, we don't branch the tempest plugins."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-08-13 13:42:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Well, we now published versions and I agree with you Dmitry, except
 > there seems to be the desire to have versioned releases (which
 > makes less sense with the goal of tempest in mind. I just see
 > having the branch as a means to bump the revision number and
 > release because perfection is unobtainable. That being said, I'm
 > pretty much out of all spoons on this subject though because of the
 > back and forth that has occurred. Marking -1.

We want to tag versions so that someone consuming the plugins knows what to use to certify their cloud. We do not want to branch because we want the same tests run against all branches of the project in our CI."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-08-13 13:51:12.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Clarity provided via discussion in #openstack-qa'}]

commit_message:
Remove the CoprHD driver

The CoprHD driver was marked unsupported
in Rocky and the vendor has indicated that
the driver is deprecated.  Given the feedback
I am removing the driver.

Change-Id: I978315402edeb0c5dd6aee28315973fa502b0e20

subject: WIP Better output when not sourcing auth
messages:
[{'account_id': 15895, 'date': '2018-07-05 10:38:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-07-09 10:51:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

LGTM. It might be aa good idea to have somebody with more Keystone knowledge check this over'}, {'account_id': 21970, 'date': '2018-07-17 08:14:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

If Keystone auth is not possible (no user:pw or token), the default should be the NO_AUTH. This is how it works (implicitly) today and should not be changed to ensure BC. Let's try to avoid having to modify existing test cases to make this change pass. The keystone authentication part should be enhanced to include details in the error message."}, {'account_id': 15895, 'date': '2018-08-13 13:38:13.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Won't fix. It breaks other mistral user cases"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-05 10:38:57.000000000', 'message': "WIP Better output when not sourcing auth

Right now when you don't have the correct auth on your env when you call
mistral it gives you a not very helpful error, like:

HTTPConnectionPool... Max retries exceeded ... Failed to establish a new
connection: [Errno 111] Connection refused',))

This change to if the authentication is keystone based you need either a
token or an username and password.

The WIP part of it is that I want to make sure that having either token
or (username and password) is a valid keystone requirement

Change-Id: Ib817857cc722ab241aa7120fa4cd4fa744228353
"}]
commit_message:
WIP Better output when not sourcing auth

Right now when you don't have the correct auth on your env when you call
mistral it gives you a not very helpful error, like:

HTTPConnectionPool... Max retries exceeded ... Failed to establish a new
connection: [Errno 111] Connection refused',))

This change to if the authentication is keystone based you need either a
token or an username and password.

The WIP part of it is that I want to make sure that having either token
or (username and password) is a valid keystone requirement

Change-Id: Ib817857cc722ab241aa7120fa4cd4fa744228353

commit_message:
Follow the new PTI for document build

In order to follow the new PTI for doc build, this patch:
1)removes unused build_sphinx in setup.cfg
2)move doc dependencies from test-requirements.txt to doc/requirements.txt
3)update tox.ini

For compliance with the Project Testing Interface as described in:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/project-testing-interface.html

For more details information, please refer to:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-December/125710.html

Change-Id: Ic700f04b857516ce5b25ce5e0fc431d1f08e24f3

commit_message:
Added drivers for coordination.

Into gnocchi_pip_packages were added kazoo and redis packages.
These services are adviced by Tooz as coordinators backends.

Coordination is required to get metrics processing distribution among
service containers/instances.

Change-Id: Iaa608bf6690f35b1aa4afd08b1d60b0752230c4e

None of the test and service client should be reply on api_version things on volume after this series[1]. Few are left which i am going to remove in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/590096/

Volume tests should be run-able on either endpoint (v2 or v3) based on configured catalog type. 

What next we need to do is to remove the _api_version from volume tests which are not required after https://review.openstack.org/#/c/589102/

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/q/topic:volume-default-testing-v3+(status:open+OR+status:merged)'}, {'account_id': 27078, 'date': '2018-08-09 04:43:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1

Looks good to me!'}, {'account_id': 20378, 'date': '2018-08-09 13:44:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

to be clear, we're talking about deployments that have only cinder v2 deployed. Does devstack do that on our experiment tempest-cinder-v2-api job? I'm guessing they don't based on the run logs here http://logs.openstack.org/77/589977/1/experimental/tempest-cinder-v2-api/70b755b/controller/logs/tempest_log.txt"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-08-12 09:24:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> to be clear, we're talking about deployments that have only cinder
 > v2 deployed. Does devstack do that on our experiment
 > tempest-cinder-v2-api job? I'm guessing they don't based on the run
 > logs here http://logs.openstack.org/77/589977/1/experimental/tempest-cinder-v2-api/70b755b/controller/logs/tempest_log.txt

Yeah, main idea of moving cinder testing to default was to make the cinder service clients version-less. Previously cinder testing was done based on api_version present on service client. But now we removed the api_version based approach and testing it based on catalog_type. all the existing tests should be able to run-able on both API version. 

If catalog_type is ``volumev2``, then all the volume
tests will run against v2 API. If catalog_type is
``volumev3`` which is default in Tempest, then all the volume
tests will run against v3 API.

Issue you are seeing in experimental job will fixed by below patch where api_version on v3 service clients are also removed. 

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/590096/"}, {'account_id': 20378, 'date': '2018-08-13 13:17:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> > to be clear, we're talking about deployments that have only

 > > v2 deployed. Does devstack do that on our experiment

 > 
 > If catalog_type is ``volumev2``, then all the volume
 > tests will run against v2 API. If catalog_type is
 > ``volumev3`` which is default in Tempest, then all the volume
 > tests will run against v3 API.

 >

great!"}, {'account_id': 20378, 'date': '2018-08-13 13:17:29.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/590096/ - should fix the issue'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-20 19:40:31.000000000', 'message': 'set volume client api_version

By default the volume clients api_version is v3 as of[1]
but after setting the options:
   volume.catalog_type = volumev2
   volume-feature-enabled.api_v2 = true

Only the service field is updated but the api_version is still
v3[2].

This results in the v3 endpoint being used which gives in a
BadRequest error, also in [2].

This patch aims to set the api_version to v2, only if the v3 api
is disabled and the v2 api is enabled.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/commit/89c213fb355f0ec672ae8002c516cf11f568960b
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/726370/

Change-Id: I75707d1e4c0614209aca317cbb5b7eb7f0c653f7
'}, {'created': '2018-07-20 19:40:59.000000000', 'message': 'set volume client api_version for v2

commit_message:
set volume client api_version for v2

By default the volume clients api_version is v3 as of[1]
but after setting the options:
   volume.catalog_type = volumev2
   volume-feature-enabled.api_v2 = true

Only the service field is updated but the api_version is still
v3[2].

This results in the v3 endpoint being used which gives in a
BadRequest error, also in [2].

This patch aims to set the api_version to v2, only if the v3 api
is disabled and the v2 api is enabled.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/commit/89c213fb355f0ec672ae8002c516cf11f568960b
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/726370/

Change-Id: I75707d1e4c0614209aca317cbb5b7eb7f0c653f7

commit_message:
Disable pid file usage in the swift_rsync container

The pidfile is useless within containers, but prevents a restart if the
process has been stopped unclean. This happens for example when a
restart takes longer than the default timeout of 10 seconds.

This is mainly a workaround because the pid file setting is hardcoded in
the used Puppet module template. It should be removed later once the
setting can be disabled cleanly with an updated Puppet rsync module.

Related-Bug: 1724559
Change-Id: Iecf855a785bc1f787234e4e54430c929cb9cb906
(cherry picked from commit 448e04029e5d8bc982cbc3fbd4409304488437ec)

commit_message:
Pass microversion info through from Profile

Even though Profile is going away, senlinclient is still using it.
There is a patch up to fix that, but in the meantime, let's fix it for
their issue. api_version in Profile is the variable for setting a
default microversion, but the translation method didn't set it.

(cherry-picked from commit 6464422a2b911499556d4b82b44532f6d569857b)

Change-Id: Id8ed4a6c5d5a26a96944cf7f9dca6d3272784dac
Story: 2003146

commit_message:
Fixed wrong when condition in mounting staging location

Just a string(when: glance_staging_nfs_share) as done in [1] without
any comparison in when condition is not working.

Adding comparision to non empty string to fix this.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/569970/1..2/puppet/services/glance-api.yaml@377

Change-Id: Ie6dc460e3853bc4ecce50e5294903a837d38b546
(cherry picked from commit 22645d3856a6576488ab7bdf45f7f32df4d52da9)

- Containerless variables removed, as we don't provide support for that
  since Queens.

Change-Id: I02b0b2c644e931592c14ade5b3de66ffbd136b03

commit_message:
Refactor migration for a cleaner up/bottom

- We only have dhcp and migration top level ymls
- Role default variables like 'var: "{{ var }}"' have been removed
- Containerless variables removed, as we don't provide support for that
  since Queens.

Change-Id: I02b0b2c644e931592c14ade5b3de66ffbd136b03

commit_message:
Upgrade Apache Kafka to ver. 0.10.2.2 in devstack

Keep log message format to ver. 0.9.0 to support old kafka-python
consumers.

Note on the backport: in stable branches we use Kafka 0.10.2.2
rather than the original 1.0.1 since this is the oldest
version to fix CVE-2018-1288[0]. Consequently our CI for
stable branches should use at least this version to ensure we
support a Kafka release without this vulnerability.

[0] https://www.securityfocus.com/bid/104900

Story: 2002746
Task: 22599

Change-Id: I6a092d64906a939d404abb3e43fc017d2eee74ea
(cherry picked from commit 7ee549b422290b4acb96e34b51b85f033cf2b6fa)

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Manually removed:
* openstack-python35-jobs template
* openstack-tox-lower-constraints job

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/591086
Change-Id: I7814e6b136ddb6f66d7919299cb6a7499fcd3233
Cherry-picked from 826bd60a84aeb6a5baf54de54d02b4eed519978d

commit_message:
Set known hosts when --limit is set.

When the option --limit is specified the tasks will
run only on those hosts passed in the option (or all
except the one passed if patterns are used), for that
reason we can't consider that the facts will be
available for all hosts inside the 'overcloud' group.

This patch appends a new line into the known hosts file
with the available 'overcloud' group hosts instead of
creating a new ssh_known_hosts file.

(cherry picked from commit 44ed2ea4b8bb0126c5b4a65e7712000d9b9f4655)

Change-Id: I8c687c53aa4cff18ac15c332a72fb40ed730e69c
Closes-Bug: #1782168

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ie17b8fd07604e030e6ea6b9ded75e85794cb881a

commit_message:
osc: Don't pass parameters with null value

Don't pass parameters docker_volume_size, flavor_id and
master_flavor_id if they are null.

This is to be compatible with Ocata version of Magnum API.

Change-Id: I0d89e1b973585ae5d4633843feedc0c35b4f624a
Closes-Bug: #1779160

commit_message:
VMware: fix TypeError while get console log

nova.privsep.path.last_bytes needs path instead of FILE.

Change-Id: Ifad71b4583b23ff018d757760a7b79f7f838c755
Closes-Bug: #1752824
